Cream crodo with caffe latte', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cream crodo with caffe latte'}]
text: The coffee and baked goods are very good. The cream crodo (I think that's what it's called?) is a cronut covered in sugar and filled with cream. It is a very good, albeit not healthy, piece. The caffe latte is also very good. The salmon and horseradish sandwich had a bit too much horseradish but it was by no means a bad sandwich. Overall, a very good place to drop in for breakfast, brunch, or a snack. Also a good place to get some work done.

text:
Maxwell Food Centre is my 2nd favorite Hawker Centre in Singapore. Granted, I was only able to visit 5 of them, but we hit up a lot of the highest rated ones and most recommended by locals.

Of course, you have to try the original Tian Tian Hainanese Chicken Rice, but make sure you also stop by Zhen Zhen Porridge, Special Shanghai Tim-Sum Tong Xing Ju, & China Street Fritters.

text: This little coffee shop was a great escape from the heat. The interior reminded me of coffee shops that you find in the Northwest. I got the affogato (ice cream with espresso). Both the coffee & ice cream were of superior quality making it a wonderful afternoon snack on a hot day.

text: Of the 5 hawker centres that I was able to go to, this one is my favorite. The food here is cheap, the portions are a good size to sample everything, but most importantly, the food is just amazing. Make sure to stop by Zhong Guo La Mian Xiao Long Bao for XLB and On Tap to wash down all the heavenly delicacies.

Calamari, sweet potato, fried lotus  (9 Elements set/Meat)', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Calamari, sweet potato, fried lotus  (9 Elements set/Meat)'}]
text:
A feast for all the senses! Sustainably sourced ingredients are delicately crafted into whimsical and flavorful dishes at the restaurant in Mahota Commune. The service is also to notch and impeccable. 

Tip: Call ahead to make reservations especially if your party is big.

I enjoyed a Heidinger pale ale poured into super chilled Steins. Then they served bread at room temperature with nutty olive oil and balsamic. At the table, there is cracked pepper and salt to dress the dip. Furthermore, there is a sauce station where you can dip your bread or accompany your meal with delicious bursts of flavor: Black sesame, pesto, ginger, tomato, konbu, And a secret Spicy Mahota blend. At the station, they also have thinly sliced chilies, minced garlic, green onion and cilantro.

I chose the 9 Element Set with meat. There is also a 9 Element Set that is vegetarian.
This tasting set arrived in a lovely wooden box with a lid. The server revealed my meal with flair. It was overwhelmingly beautiful. I ate across the rows from top to bottom, left to right. I enjoyed the cold kebab of handcrafted sausage, cantaloupe ball and grape tomato with a tangy citrus sauce. Cold cut thinly sliced roast beef with carrot filigree and caviar-like goodness. I accompanied that course with the ginger and black sesame sauces. I also enjoyed the Konbu salad and the smoke salmon. My parents shared the hot pot. Wow! The broth was super tasty after all the raw ingredients were added and enjoyed. Our table also ordered the mushroom soup that was smooth and creamy. The humongous pork knuckle was tasty and texturrific! The crackling was fabulous. Try the meat with the different sauce offering!

The wait staff was always there clearing plates and making sure that there was plenty of water and other libations desired. Mahota is a great place to eat and feel good about sending love to Mother Earth!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iD0vUT8owTejNUyUvq2KRg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/geometry-singapore?reviewid=vnRUsRSxubzOH9lnRgDpNg&select=iD0vUT8owTejNUyUvq2KRg', 'altText': 'Photo of Geometry - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ddTzzs2lAJwWWgI0LRbCjA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/geometry-singapore?reviewid=vnRUsRSxubzOH9lnRgDpNg&select=ddTzzs2lAJwWWgI0LRbCjA', 'altText': 'Photo of Geometry - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
I've been thinking of this tart ever since I had it! It's a crumbly sweet mix filling and don't be "fooled" when they recommend you pair it with fruit flavours. 

It goes great with sea salt caramel or bing bong. The sea salt here is unusually good and I've had it at bing bing and creamier. 

Bing bong is multi coloured like paddle pop. They cautioned it might be too sweet for the tart but my Japanese friend and I thought it was great. 

Came atop their classic tart and it was beautiful and so yummy. 

Like many places nowadays you can ask for tastings. 

We also ordered 4 flat whites. They wouldn't say who provides their beans but it was a Brazilian blend. I thought it was not bad but a touch burnt at first but as I drank on, it grew on me. Concluded it was one of those cups with a dark chocolate profile which can be a bit borderline to my taste buds as I prefer fruitier coffees. 

I like that the staff had really warm happy smiles. 

It's a small space here. Cosy. And help yourself to water. But they use disposable cups so I felt a bit bad. Prefer if they have cheap plastic reusable cups. The place is small so not like need to wash a lot of cups.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ca-qtTa9nKS9BjVr2EFGEg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ya-kun-kaya-toast-singapore-9?reviewid=QbyYCB8hC60AroMnWNHtnA&select=ca-qtTa9nKS9BjVr2EFGEg', 'altText': 'Photo of Ya Kun Kaya Toast - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast with butter and iced Milo', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Kaya toast with butter and iced Milo'}]
text:
Although this place is a chain, I'm still a big fan of this classic Singaporean breakfast chain. The usual kaya toast with butter, and soft-boiled eggs and iced Milo is the winning combo.

My boyfriend and I walked into this place on one morning and got told that the hot drinks maker was down, but Singapore is always warm anyway, so why get the hot drinks? We were however puzzled on how on earth the soft-boiled eggs would be consumed, but the instinct took over and we soon munched the toast-dipped-in egg like a local would.

Service is neither friendly nor rude, just the usual efficiency you see in Singapore and I was at least being grateful to be greeted in English, and not Chinese as everyone in Chinatown assumed that I could speak Mandarin (in which I couldn't). I would still go to this place again if I'm nearby, but for now - a jar of kaya jam bought from Singapore should do the trick when I'm at home in Copenhagen. It won't be the same, but at least I didn't have to endure the 12-hour flight.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qImbuVHwYLB6cSrApSVkkw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/craftsmen-specialty-coffee-singapore-3?reviewid=vo6K3HpOLIyuO4YnuxWptA&select=qImbuVHwYLB6cSrApSVkkw', 'altText': 'Photo of Craftsmen Specialty Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Soy chai latte + blackforest cake', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Soy chai latte + blackforest cake'}]
text:
Craftsmen burger with fries ($16.90) - 3 stars
Nothing special. Swopped the fries out for a salad so can't comment on the fries, but they were nice enough to do that!

Tea time set ($10.90 + $1.50 for a soy chai)

Blackforest cake - 3 stars
More a chocolate cake with a couple of cherries and chocolate mousse than a blackforest cake. The chocolate cake itself was a bit dry but the mousse was good. The cherries didn't have much flavour.

Soy chai latte - 4.5 stars
This was excellent! It was the best thing I ordered.

No tax or service charge!

Ambience - 4 stars

Service - 5 stars

text:
Believe it or not, I was dragged here by my Swedish boyfriend because he saw the word "fika" along with a picture of Moose outside the cafe. Yes, as you might have guessed it, it's a "Swedish" cafe, right in the Kampong Glam area in Singapore.

How Swedish can it be? Well the decor inside is very Ikea-ish and they do have a lot of Swedish dishes like meatballs (halal, obviously), pytt i panna and many other dishes that were on the menu. Since we weren't feeling like eating Swedish dishes in Singapore (hello, laksa!), we came here just to get refreshments and shade from the harsh Singaporean sun.

Boyfriend ordered (Swedish) coffee while I got myself a lingonberry-ade that was surprisingly fresh and nice (a little bit sour). We shared an earl gray cake, although there was prinsesstårta in the cake shelf.  

Overall, it's a nice ambiance, maybe for Singaporeans who want to try out Swedish stuff, or for the Swedes who miss food from home, but as for me, it's just another concept cafe that is currently trending in Southeast Asia

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vEwL_IFCzZcX25IU1dwluQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/jimmy-monkey-cafe-and-bar-singapore?reviewid=gKQlMIyEipGbZukGBXHLpw&select=vEwL_IFCzZcX25IU1dwluQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Jimmy Monkey Cafe & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Pork hash', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pork hash'}]
text: I've been here a few times since I discovered Jimmy Monkey. Each time for breakfast on the weekend. Grab a menu and order at the counter, then the wait staff will bring out the food. The coffee is excellent, and I love the vibe of the place. The staff is friendly and attentive. Yes, the food is a little price-y, but not too far out of range for this kind of place. My favorite so far is the hash. Just a little bit of spice and just satisfying enough for brunch.

text: A nice, quiet cafe to chill in town especially on weekdays! What makes this cafe unique is that it is an extension of their furniture shop-great for kids to wait with a cuppa while their parents shop for furniture, or simply to experience the furniture and style the shop offers. I would recommend getting the cake set (a drink and a cake for just $10). The icing on the cake (pun intended) is definitely the warm and friendly service of the baristas! Definitely a favourite of mine :)

text: Have been here couple of times and the food and coffee served are quite good, though I felt it was a bit pricey. Staff are helpful and friendly and the management really do care about their employees. Cosy setting, nice place to chill but it is usually crowded during lunch and dinner.

text: Instagram worthy Cafe. Nice desserts, cosy atmosphere, good place to chill out. The desserts were ok, nothing exceptional but presentation was good. Coffee was ok.

This is my 2nd visit, I love the pancake and also the chicken and waffle. The maple butterscotch syrup is a bomb! Supper yummy but can be too sweet for some people, so advice don't pour it a one go. 

Portion can be huge if you don't have a big appetite 
 
Can be crowed during weekend and dinner time, so advice to make your reservation in advance if you planing dinner or weekend brunch here.

Tips : You can make reservation via Chope app.

text:
Fresh fruit salad with buttermilk and cinnamon crumble ($9) - 3 stars
Small portion.

Ambience - 4 stars
I liked that it wasn't too crowded or noisy on a weekday morning. Wifi available but it wasn't working that day.
Croissants were $7 each, which is pricey!

Latte', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Latte'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gq9lmIeCtEVJ604_AopYyw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/stamping-ground-singapore-2?reviewid=zmASAUcWSKE1dFJdvXqGcw&select=Gq9lmIeCtEVJ604_AopYyw', 'altText': 'Photo of Stamping Ground - Singapore, Singapore. Avocado and egg on toast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Avocado and egg on toast'}]
text:
The space is beautiful and co-shared with a floral shop. The coffee is good (beans from papa palheta) and my husband got 2 lattes straight one after the other. Prices are typical of cafes. Food wise, a good enough selection that aims to satisfy any cravings. Though nothing mind blowing, the ingredients are fresh and delicious. Will be back for sure!

No reservations taken and seating is largely communal. Baby chairs available.

I was taken here for a late Sunday dinner and the porridge ala carte buffet is really quite delish. They differ from your standard porridge outside with the dishes cooked to order. We had the prawn paste chicken (3.5/5), deep fried baby squid, chyepoh egg, and pomfret. Everything here was of a good standard and quality, and if you were after the homecooked feeling, you might actually find it here.

The waitstaff are personable, doling out recommendations freely, which I really liked. On their recommendation, do go for the kuehs at the dessert counter, as they are from a reputable bakery chain in Singapore - nom! Would return.

the one thing on the menu that brings great joy to me is the sweet potato latte.
i always loved this drink when i was living in Seoul so it was awesome to have it available in Singapore. the cafe atmosphere was cosy with a variety of seating options. the menu comes with food. Great for those who may want more than a drink. i bought the credit top up card and whenever you use that, you'll get a 10% discount on your bill. Definitely would return to try their other items on the menu.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vljyTKnWJWqcygCqaS4-_A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/jewel-coffee-at-millenia-walk-singapore?reviewid=WjkG8pJFqBXK3Da5gJadPA&select=vljyTKnWJWqcygCqaS4-_A', 'altText': 'Photo of Jewel Coffee at Millenia Walk - Singapore, Singapore. Mocha', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Mocha'}]
text:
One of the many great cafes at millennia walk-love how quiet it is (off lunch hours). You can always count on them for a good cup of Joe and recommendations on beans!

There are also power plugs at the side with high tables to ensure that your devices are fully charged for meetings and work! Staff are friendly and approachable, don't be afraid to ask for recommendations! :)

text:
It's a hawker centre, a paradise for food. Albeit this place is relatively small for a hawker centre and the whole thing is under construction (you have to walk the way around the building site), this place offers whatever you feel like. Meeting up with friends who have different taste in food from you? No problem. You can find anything.

I had noodle soup first time I was here, the second was fried cockles kway teow. They have also the famous chicken rice (blame my not-eating-poultry- policy) but I didn't taste any. It's a perfect walking distance to downtown Chinatown, so if you feel like you don't want to go where tourists go, go here instead.

text:
The place looked great with lots of cartoon character figures around. I was shown to a chosen table which I later found that the chair had oily stains on.

Quite a lot of choices on the menu. Prices were more on the high sides. 

Wonder Woman's Box Office Power Drink ($10.90++)
An ice-blended beverage created with all-time favourite salted caramel popcorn flavour
The drink was quite sweet and lacking of the popcorn taste which one was expecting. Instead it tasted more like oreo cookie. Maybe it should have a change of description.

Paradise Island Mac & Cheese  (S$18.90++)
Conchiglie rigate baked in special 5 cheese  sauce and mentaiko sauce, flavoured with white button mushrooms , turkey  bacon and garlic
My first choice was pancake but I was informed it was not available more than 10 minutes after I had placed my order. The pasta was well cooked and flavourful, although one could not taste the 5 distinct taste of cheese nor the pollack roe which was commonly found in mentaiko sauce. The dish itself was a tab dry. Didn't really found any garlic, but there was shrimps in it. Needed another change of description here.

text: Meet with friends to have dinner here. The food are really cute with the gudetama expression on it. And it tastes not bad too. Their fries is really good though. We ordered the family platter to share among us. It's just nice for us. My friends bought back some desserts and I bought their tissue box lols! Because it's too kawaii ! They have the promotion for it. But I have to say that the price and charges from this cafe is really pricey. Food added service charge and tax. The products that I bought are also with tax.  but just for a one time try, this is good.

Update 28 Jun

Favorite Sandwich - 3.5 stars
Bacon and egg sandwich on olive ciabatta with rocket on the side. Decent but nothing special.

Salmon and kale - 4 stars
Salmon was cooked perfectly and a good size.

$43 for both.

=============

Smoked beet and duck salad ($12.90 before GST and service charge) - 4 stars
A good portion of spinach, duck, pomegranate, cheese, pine nuts, sweet potato and beets with just the right amount of flavoring - the duck was salted but not too much. Not a huge fan of the way the beets were cooked but I'll live. I want to give it more stars but there's something about the dish overall that I didn't quite enjoy. Maybe it's just because I've had too many sweet potato salads at home. But for the price and portion it's one of the better salads I've had here for sure. 3.75 for the flavors, 0.25 for the price and portion.

Soy matcha latte ($5.90 + $0.60 for soy = $6.50 before GST++) - 4 stars
Pricey because it's small. Flavor was rich and good.

I want to come back for the waffles and cakes! They offer a dinner menu after 6pm too. Open daily from 9am-10pm but closed on Tuesdays.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/BlkgGthJFbB8eMNkFm1f0A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coconut-club-singapore?reviewid=GK_SUSH7rSsrwBD3iZA40w&select=BlkgGthJFbB8eMNkFm1f0A', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coconut Club - Singapore, Singapore. Nasi lemak and sayur lemak!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nasi lemak and sayur lemak!'}]
text:
Despite the price tag and what I thought would be too hipster to be good, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food at The Coconut Club! Of course, I still thought it was utterly overpriced, but for a nice restaurant in Club Street with a/c and yummy food? Aiight, I'll pay for it.

I went on a Friday night and got a seat right away which is a nice change for Club Street that's always bustling and with people spilling onto the street. Service was fairly prompt, and it would have been nice to have the specials on the board instead of me having to ask if the menu was all there is to it and then the server then filling in the gaps on their specials of the day.

I ordered the nasi lemak (of course) and the sayur lemak (which is apparently the less creamy version of sayur lodeh - it certainly tasted that way too) which was one of the specials. The nasi lemak came out looking delicious! The rice was coconut-y and fragrant, the egg was a nice oozy crisp, the ikan bilis was fried without being too hard, the chilli was a little too much on the spicy side (and just not as delicious as the one at Adam Road) and the chicken was glorious. The chicken was a full thigh and drumstick, was marinated in this delicious marinade (lots of local herbs - lemongrass and the like) and fried to juicy perfection. Yum. The sayur lemak had a really good broth - possibly ikan bilis? I made the unfortunate mistake of mixing all the chilli into it and ended up sniffling my way through my meal although it was really quite delicious. Although they also serve alcohol, my dining companion and I both got the lemongrass tea which was serviceable.

This was all-in-all a very satisfying meal, and although I might still return to Adam Road for my nasi lemak fix (at a much lower price point too), I wouldn't say no to anyone asking me to get nasi lemak if I were ever in the Club Street area.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zK_w8K8CtcUV2JSE5yR47A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/sunday-folks-singapore?reviewid=pU0oS70LDmEUmM0d12lx8A&select=zK_w8K8CtcUV2JSE5yR47A', 'altText': 'Photo of Sunday Folks - Singapore, Singapore. Sea salt gula melaka ice cream with sad mochi and a pocky shoved in for good measure', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Sea salt gula melaka ice cream with sad mochi and a pocky shoved in for good measure'}]
text:
They used to have awfully long lines but it seems to have petered out. It's still incredibly popular though, despite the massive price tag for what they offer.

I literally only get the sea salt gula melaka ice cream here because the cakes are disappointing at best, and the waffles are nothing to write home about. The first couple of times I came, they had relatively nice shiratama balls on the ice cream. Now they serve it with some sad little mochi that aren't very good.

The ice cream is still pretty good so I would return for that. I took off a star because the quality has dropped since the last time I was here, and another because the prices don't quite justify their popularity.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/7zpWvKDNTV-hAG4I2xAEGQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/food-for-thought-singapore?reviewid=L3dFMxuWxeifudNQVI9eyw&select=7zpWvKDNTV-hAG4I2xAEGQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Food For Thought - Singapore, Singapore. Full Works: Scrambled Eggs, Brioche Toast, Mixed Greens, Pome Noisettes, Bacon, Sausage and Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Full Works: Scrambled Eggs, Brioche Toast, Mixed Greens, Pome Noisettes, Bacon, Sausage and Sauteed Garlic Mushrooms'}]
text: Convenient and good portions. My niece and I wanted a quick bite and walked to the Singapore Botanic Gardens. I was expecting a food court but instead, Food for Thought had taken over the space. My niece had the spaghetti bolognese (kid's meal), and I enjoyed a big breakfast. Scrambled eggs, bacon, ham came with nicely toasted brioche and I loved the sauteed mushrooms. I enjoyed my meal. The eggs were a little on the overdone side, but I did not leave hungry. The decor is a little run down. The servers were helpful once you spoke to them. You have to walk to the order and pay station.

There are a few times in life when a meal overwhelms your senses with craftsmanship and complexity. This meal is not it. It is middle of the road fare at unreasonable prices. 

Very unremarkable food that certainly could be better prepared in the home kitchen. 

I ordered an $11 banana-blueberry smoothie expecting a taste that justifies the price. Instead, I received a blueberry smoothie without the banana because the kitchen had none in stock. I wasn't even given a choice to decline or change my order, rather it was served to me expecting me to just take it. I did, because I don't like causing a scene, and it was as disappointing as my $13 breakfast sandwich with $5 has brown top up as their dishes don't come with sides. Sad!

Pretty good eggs Benedict, however, the mushroom tapenade overwhelmed the dish. Spanish breakfast was decent as well, but doesn't outshine that of Wild Honey's. 

Nice hipsterustic atmosphere without hipster smugness and judgementalism.

A little late here but WELCOME TO THE HOOD Firebake! Can I just say that Firebake Woodfired Bakehouse and Restaurant is my favorite dining spot in the East? I've been waiting with bated breath ever since I heard that Konstantino (or Tino) is gonna open up a place to sell his kickass sourdough bread made. Plus this passionate man was building a full-scale woodfire oven just so that he can bake his breads in (how's that for passion)! Of course, you can expect that I made many rounds around their block so that I can be the first to check them out when they open.

Tino is truly an artisan who is devoted to his craft. From raw ingredients to firewood to water, everything is as non-processed, sustainable, and close to its natural state as possible. Organic flour, natural non-iodised and non-processed salt, water that has been treated using Firebake's elaborate Nordaq Fresh water filtration system, all these pure ingredients go into the making of a perfect loaf. 
Of course, there's more to just freshly baked breads here. The menu here features contemporary dishes cooked with traditional European techniques, which complement and showcase the range of woodfire baked sourdough bread. 

But first, bread! For first timers, the Firebake Bread Board with Greek extra virgin olive oil and the special Norwegian Roros Smor cultured butter ($10) is a great way to sample the different sourdoughs. There's the fluffy and chewy white which is perfect with the pate; a wholesome wholemeal with caraway which is lovely with the butter; a triple fermented rye for making a satisfying sandwich; and a fruit with plump sultanas and apricots that is perfect on its own or with more butter. The breads are also available in loaves ($8-13) and trust me they will be gone in no time.

You can make a meal out of just the bread, but make sure there's space for the rest! The 4-Spice Chicken Liver Pate ($12) is a smooth one, made with an equal ratio of butter. I love how it spreads beautifully on the white sourdough. It is also served with another slice of fruit loaf if you're into the sweet and savory combination.

Other refreshing appetizers that make perfect pairings with the breads include a Mediterranean style cold Smoked Eggplant ($15) with spiced hummus, tomato and Manchego.

The Heirloom Tomatoes ($17), provide bursts of flavor with smoked oil, feta, pickled cucumber and other aromatics. The mix is soaked overnight in tomato jus to enhance its flavor. Of course, sourdough croutons go into this one.

My favorite is the Wood-fired Pumpkin with Burrata ($16)! My mouth is watering just thinking about the creamy buffalo cheese with a sprinkle of pistachio dukkah, orange blossom, and a touch of molasses. In fact, I had this as my main on an occasion. 

Favorite must-have main? The Cured Norwegian Salmon ($23). Love that pink in the center and how smoky it is. Plus that bread crust for added texture and some grassy sauteed leeks to go with. 

The Norwegian Blue Mussels ($25) is cooked in Golden Ale (rather than wine), and flavored with chorizo and butter. I found this a bit bland and the only flavor was from the bits of chorizo (and only when i bit into them).

The Australian Prawn Capellini Aglio Olio with Sakura Ebi ($19) has an amazing aroma from the grilled prawns and prawn oil. I would love for punchier flavor (garlic and spice) but the pure seafood fragrance becomes more pronounced as you chew on it. Maybe give it a sprinkle of salt to enhance the dish a little.

The Grilled Pork Belly ($22) with garden vegetable broth is what i'd reach for on a cold night. The vegetable broth is like a clear sweet minestrone, all naturally flavored by the pumpkin and celeriac. The sous-vide pork is given the cast iron grill treatment before being served and that crunchy skin is yums. The pork is kinda porky (if you know what i mean), so not all may take to this. 

Another hit is the Rangers Valley Striploin of Wagyu grade A3! A 300gm slab for only $38? COUNT ME IN.

Firebake Bread and Butter pudding ($10) is so damn good please. Make sure you call and reserve it as they only serve 12 a night currently! This is made using their fruit loaf and soaked with creme anglais. It's a small bowl, but it goes a long way..

For a lighter but nevertheless sweet ending, go with the Moscato Poached Peach with a sourdough ice cream (SAY WERT) and rye chips ($12). The ice cream is a little like yogurt, with the nice pull to it.

Head on over to Firebake for the rustic dishes and lovely breads. They also serve a special blend of coffee from Jimmy Monkey, and there's also nitro-coffee available. For drinks of an alcoholic nature, there are affordable craft beers, and boutique wines to complement your meal. Alternatively, sip on some Nordaq Fresh water (still or sparkling) for $3/4 (free flow). Firebake is now open for dinner and they have just started a weekend brunch service too! GO NAOOOO!

Robertson Quay is undergoing some serious revival with new hotels and changes in the food scene along the river. A homegrown favorite SPRMRKT has expanded and set up shop at the Singapore Tyler Print Institute (STPI) Creative Workshop & Gallery. I've walked past several times but only noticed their bistro concept SPRMRKT Daily. Little did i know that their Kitchen & Bar, which serves refined European food, is tucked away upstairs through a side stairway.

The spot is absolutely gorgeous in the day with expansive views of the idyllic riverside. Lunch sets are offered, starting from $30, served with coffee or tea. They have also started their weekend brunches and we say grab a table now!

For lunch, start with a simple but wholesome Brussels & Roots with a honey clove dressing. The vegetables are simply steamed- golden baby beetroots and baby turnips along with the Australian Brussels sprouts. The garden of greens is flavored with pops of umami from the slow-baked tomatoes seasoned with thyme, garlic, sea salt and olive oil.

For lunch, go for a lighter Pan-Roasted Chilean Sea Bass. The fish is seared and basted with butter, then finished in the oven with a simple touch of salt, pepper, and lemon juice. A refreshing ratatouille adds a juicy crunch to the mix. We agreed with the chicken stock flavored polenta which was rich and velvety with some Parmesan sharpness.

For dinner, the Firefly Squid ($24) surprised us with a bacon-like smokiness in the meatless cauliflower puree. I have no idea how but i'd take all the cauliflower puree as a guiltless replacement. The special firefly squid from Japan is intensely flavored, having been marinated overnight in soya sauce, sake, mirin and brown sugar. 

Definitely order the Octopus & Prawn ($24). This has to be one of the best (if not the best) Spanish octopus i've eaten this year. The octopus is simmered whole with mirepoix and other spices and white wine for 2 - 3 hours before grilling on a plancha. The crispy skin and that tender flesh were unforgettable.

I didn't like the Fjord Trout ($19). I'm not sure if it's due to the way it's cooked- mi cuit style, sous vide with salt, but the flesh was mushy and powdery. The flavor was great, just not the texture. 

Fresh pasta are a must these days. If you like something really meaty, the Malbec Oxtail Pasta ($32) with a smoky Scamorza will satisfy. The oxtail is braised with Malbec (my favorite wine) to impart that berries, plum, and chocolate flavor. Perfect comfort food. Can i have another glass of Malbec to go with this please?

A favorite at SPRMKT is the Smoked Lobster Tail ($42) which features a cold smoked and then seared Maine lobster with toasted garlic panko bread crumbs and a Mac n Cheese. The cheese sauce is a lot lighter than usual as they have added pumpkin puree to the Emmental, aged Parmesan, and Mozzarella mix. 

I absolutely love the Twice Cooked Chicken Roulade ($28). I've not had a chicken so good in a while. The juicy chicken thigh is brined overnight and then rolled with a creamy spinach and mushroom duxelle, before being cooked sous vide and then shallow fried for that amazing Peking-duck-like crispy skin. It's great on its own, with its own jus, or with the amazing curry cauliflower puree (seriously they are so good with their cauliflowers). 

I can go on forever about the other tender juicy red that is the Stockyard Côte de Boeuf ($94). This 200 days grain-fed 600g Australian bone-in beef ribs is good for 2. The ribs are first coated with a house made Creole spice rub before being seared and roasted. Drizzle a little of that beef jus made with roasted bones, red wine, tomatoes, and veal jus for some tart umami. The meat is served with mixed mushrooms, roasted rosemary tomatoes and vine-ripened tomatoes. Perfect date meal!

End your meal with a fragrant and light Earl Grey Creme Brûlée ($16) scented with a lemon lavender streusel base and fresh seasonal fruits.

For something rich and earthy, the Three Beet Chocolate Lava Cake ($18) delighted us with the medley of textures created with the versatile root. Of course, we cannot resist a 70% Valrhona dark chocolate lava cake. I wouldn't be surprised to see more of this beetroot and raspberry sorbet on the market. I'm already seeing a lot of beetroot on the menu of many noteworthy restaurants.

text:
Popped by here on a Saturday noon for brunch, and the nicer interior was all reserved so we had to sit outside (2 people), so it would be prudent to call ahead at peak times. 

I had the fish tacos and a hot chocolate with soy milk. My companion had the big breakfast and a cappuccino. My fish tacos came with salad and curly fries, which I really liked, and wiped out. The tacos themselves were okay, with fish and a mango salsa, and a very crunchy taco. I do wish they had a cream element within to balance the flavors, but all in all, I wasn't disappointed. My hot choc wasn't overly sweet, and still frothy despite the soy. Yum. 

While the prices are on the high side because of its location, it is still cheaper than it's upstairs neighbor, and offers non-brekkie options for you! 

I didn't get any coffee because I don't drink coffee - but I've heard it's good!

text:
This is my favorite toastbox, located at B4 @Ion Orchard near the escalator (turn left when heading down the escalator).

My usual will be the kaya toast. When I was still a little child, my mom would make her own kaya. My mom's kaya was so good. Kaya is not something I eat very often, I don't know why. I mean after all where can I get kaya when I am in Atlanta? Recent times a friend of mine who seems to love a good kaya toast from Toastbox got me hooked on this simple breakfast.

Sometimes I will order the kaya traditional set which comes with a slice of kaya toast, two soft boiled eggs and a beverage. Other times I just order the toast and a beverage from the al la carte section.

I wish the staff would crack the eggs for me like those at Ya Kun, but ok I should not be so lazy. The kaya toast here definitely edged out those at Ya Kun.

I like this location not only the toast was made perfectly every time, the staffs are always nice. I usually head over here really early and then stroll around and wait for the stores at Ion or other malls to open. 

There seems to be a very long line around 9-9.30am. One needs patience ;)

Nice place for coffee or drink. But avoid the over priced menu. Plain and simple food just isn't nice or worth the price.

Spaghetti Carbonara', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Spaghetti Carbonara'}]
text:
Beautiful food, friendly service, and great 2 for 1 lunch specials. This eatery does not disappoint. 

Tip: If you modify or try to substitute any of the dishes, it is no longer eligible for the 2 for 1 deal. We ordered a Caesar salad and asked for dressing on the side. The Romaine was crisp and fresh. The dressing was rich, full of flavor.

We had the pizza with mushrooms and olives, the spaghetti al funghi, spaghetti bolognese, and the pasta carbonara. The pizza had a lovely crust, sauce and the ingredients were fresh. My niece slurped up every bit of spaghetti bolognese. The carbonara was good, but not the best I have had. My favorite entree was the lovely al funghi. I believe they had 3 different kinds of mushrooms and the sauce was so fragrant.

Last but not least, the desserts were amazing. The gelato is freshly made with great flavors. The pistachio lava cake was rich and decadent and wonderfully balanced with the passionfruit sorbetto. The waffle with apple caramel was paired with chocolate gelato. Dessert was to die for. 

Thank you Chapter 55 for a fabulous meal.

text:
A tiny bakery with limited dine in area. The choices available were limited but fanciful. The coffee was made with cafe type of machine, although priced reasonable at $1.50 for a Kopi-O. Only cash and NETS are accepted for payments. Made your order and payments and collected food later when pager lighted up. Service maybe be a tab slow as there was only 2 to 3 staffs around.

Gula Jawa Sticky Rice (S$6)
Gula jawa glutinous rice, gula jawa genoise, coconut mousse
Such an interesting cake  which packed a layer of soft moist chewy glutinous rice between the soft fluffy sponge, topped with juicy nata de coco. 

Just nice to pair with a cup of Teh-O (S$1.50) for tea. The tea was sweeten slightly when served.

As someone who moved here from New York, I was accustomed to having a nice, crisp, chewy bagel at least 3 times a week. Hence upon moving to Singapore, I scour the island every time my inevitable cravings hit. 

Two Men Bagel is an obvious choice for bagel lovers and you can see from the queue that it's made up of a lot of homesick westerners. 

The bagels are no where near as massive as in New York and it doesn't have that sheen to it, but then again, they don't have the water. The sandwiches are inventive, bordering on too ambitious. Because the bagels themselves aren't that large, the filling often falls out, leaving your hands a mess. 

Like all foreign foods swept far from their homeland, it's more expensive (especially the drinks, my God it's robbery) and not as good, but it's all we have. 

+1 star for the great 90's and 00's rap and hip hop playlist, interrupted only by great 00's emo music.

Let me make it clear, I am only taking off one star because of the price, as other people mentioned, of the bowls and drinks. As everyone says, the quality is there, but for lunch, it may be too pricey for an every day occasion. 

HOWEVER, I did want to review something that most people don't think of when they think of Grain Traders: THE BAGEL SANDWICHES. Only $10 and you get: a bagel, a protein, a spread, a veggie, and something extra. I always get their plain bagels toasted (they only have 2 types of bagels unfortunately), with jalapeno cream cheese, cured salmon, avocado, and spinach. ALL THAT FOR JUST $10! Great deal! The only sad part is that breakfast is only available 8am-10:30am. Booooo. I want bagels for dinner!

text:
Mysterious
Hot
Humid
Funky
Huge!!!!!!

walk in, downstairs in the large circular warehouse-y feeling place, cement everywhere: clothes and flea type articles for sale. Go all the way to the top, and the stalls are plentiful ! Go to one for the best popia, another for duck, another for Hainan chicken, and yet another for kaya ( coconut jam) toast.

It's def a trip coming here, not even quite sure how to get in. Not enough light, not enough water....benches everywhere. Buk kut teh, I know I went to the top stall : longest queue ( no brained).

Amazing amazing food all over Singapore.

text:
I wanted in on this kaya business, as I saw references to it everywhere. Asked my friend KM what it actually was. Just toast with Asiany brioche-like bread with a slather of coconut jam atop.

Liked so much, I ordered it again at Terminal 1 in Changi, where there is also a little first floor kiosk!

Ploughman&#39;s board', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "Ploughman's board"}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/1w6dpREadek8nmHir_r0hQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/level33-singapore-4?reviewid=CTSrE4os5kzgxZe0LpVOaQ&select=1w6dpREadek8nmHir_r0hQ', 'altText': 'Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text:
LeVel33 is currently the World's Highest Urban Craft-brewery.  Enjoy a full food menu, craft beers, and/or crafted beer cocktails, with an amazing view of the Marina Bay and city skyline.  They also have a wine selection.  The restaurant has an awesome modern vibe, with warm wood tones.  A reservation is highly recommended to secure a spot here.  When you enter the large Financial Center building head to tower 1.  There will be a desk at the base of the elevators were you confirm your reservation and they will give you admittance to the elevator that heads straight to the restaurant.  The elevator will take you up 33 floors quickly (my ears popped). The doors open directly into the restaurant were you will be greeted by the smell of brewing beer.

Their crafted brews are of European heritage and made using state-of-the-art technology by SALM & Co Gmbh. They have a 33.1 Blond Lager, 33.15 India Pale Ale, 33.3 Stout, 33.4 House Porter and 33.9 Wheat Beer, with seasonal brews on the menu.  You can see the beautiful copper kettles, and silver beer vats as you walk throughout the space.  You can order a beer paddle which gives you a 0.1 litre taster of five LeVeL33 craft brews (of your choice from the options available).  This is a perfect amount for sharing.  The seasonal Golden ale was the table favorite.  The other beers were OK.  Very 1 dimensional.  Lacked character or flavor.  Had a single flavor profile which made it pair well within their beer cocktails.  Their beer cocktails are unique and tasty.  I would highly recommend them as the way to go here for the price. 

The food menu highlights European classics with a twist. The food was GREAT.  Out of the sides our table favorite was the pumpkin.  The broccolini, corn, and heirloom tomato were also tasty.  

The starters are also good.  The Ploughman's board was the best.  The seafood medley was OK.  I would definitely suggest the ploughman's board as the cured meats were addictively tasty.  I loved the crostini and rye bread that they came with.  Be sure to save room for the mains!

Our table had a mix of different mains.  From fish, to the different options of gnocchi, to the Beef & Reef, and grilled meats.  Everything was cooked to perfection. The chevre gnocchi was OK, the original gnocchi was better.  The Beef and Reef was pricey, but good.  It is quite the show as they bring out the lobster and throw it in a pot of boiling water for a minute.  The meat cut like butter.  Amazing flavors and large portions.  You will leave full.  

The prices are high. This would be a place for special occasions.  You pay for tasty food and excellent views.  Unfortunately, the beer wasn't great, but if you stick to beer cocktails or their other selection of drinks you will be OK.  With the large price tag you want to ensure you are getting something great.

The service was friendly and prompt for Singapore.  
.

Tall no whip hot chocolate.. my heart felt so awful but nothing to do with the lackluster beverage :(', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Tall no whip hot chocolate.. my heart felt so awful but nothing to do with the lackluster beverage :('}]
text:
The only Starbucks at the Marina Bay Financial Center. Located at the Marina Link Mall (underground) which is accessible to the Downtown MRT station and Raffles Place MRT station. 

Had to ask two persons how to get there from the office towers. One needs to enter through the entrance at Tower One and take the escalator down and keep walking. One should see the store ahead. 

My first tall no whip hot chocolate from Starbucks since I stepped foot on this sunny island last month. It was not good. Was I expecting it to be amazing? Not really :(

Staffs were friendly. Lots of seatings. 

Was waiting for someone to show up and he did not. Never feel so sad leaving a Starbucks. This a first but it was not Starbucks' fault and no one else either.

Update: 7/20/2017

My 2nd time to this same exact Starbucks. I guessed it was a "cruel" twist of fate I was sent to the Raffles Medical Center @ Marina Bay Financial Center Tower 3 by my doctor at Raffles Hospital. The previous time I left this Starbucks feeling so awful, though by a twist of event my friend turned up looking for me but I already left. It was quite a story. Anyhow this is not a place for me to write my own life story, lol!

FOOD/DRINK
Drink was great, I no longer want to compare the hot chocolate I always have in Atlanta. 

AMBIENCE 
Lots of seating area. I like it. 

STAFF(S)
Friendly and seemed nice like any other Starbucks barista I encountered here in Singapore. I have no complaints.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=GQh4KSCygodKKum529q_LA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4yx1J7-K8zTxhrUP9PW8wA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4yx1J7-K8zTxhrUP9PW8wA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4yx1J7-K8zTxhrUP9PW8wA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4yx1J7-K8zTxhrUP9PW8wA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4yx1J7-K8zTxhrUP9PW8wA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4yx1J7-K8zTxhrUP9PW8wA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jackay C.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Jackay C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=GQh4KSCygodKKum529q_LA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 22, 'photoCount': 489, 'reviewCount': 72, 'eliteYear': None}
text:
old hen kitchen now has a set lunch menu which is a really good deal! coffee, starter and main ranging from $15 - 19+. 

they also allow substitutions, for extra $$, depending on the coffee and/or salad you get. 

for eg: if you get their infamous cold brew instead of a flat white, you top up $2

i usually get the tomato soup (with pancetta!!), salmon soba! heard great things about the burger and the rice and pork belly usually runs out, so get their early if thats ur jam!

set lunch runs weekdays 12-230pm, excluding weekends and public holidays.

Didn't know about this place until a friend insisted on getting some because she was in the area. out of curiosity i bought the durian roll. it was a couple hours later till i got home and that was the recommended time it should be outside the fridge once you buy it from them. the expiration on these rolls is 2-3 days. 

the roll itself was fluffy and the texture was nice. not the best durian filling but it was good enough for my first try. there were many other flavours so if i am back in that part of town i would give it another try.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/KC6SEYuGtml_AWn_T39mpQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/milkissimo-singapore?reviewid=wBxWO06V7C7kyDpWvbTsGg&select=KC6SEYuGtml_AWn_T39mpQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Milkissimo - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-HPZWEaovobLfNuITrSPqA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/milkissimo-singapore?reviewid=wBxWO06V7C7kyDpWvbTsGg&select=-HPZWEaovobLfNuITrSPqA', 'altText': 'Photo of Milkissimo - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/W8ELKPFf6Ad9RV9bqlaIRg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/milkissimo-singapore?reviewid=wBxWO06V7C7kyDpWvbTsGg&select=W8ELKPFf6Ad9RV9bqlaIRg', 'altText': 'Photo of Milkissimo - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text:
You'll like this place if you are into tea. they have tea bags lining their counters and the drink i had a strong scent and taste of the oolong i ordered with a slight hint of peach.
i decided to  give it a try because they also offered cheese tea. sadly the cheese was lost in the tea and there was no hint of it other than the sight of it before i put my lips to the cup.

Great ambience with wide spaces - something hard-pressed to find in Singapore. Food range is surprising wide. Love the food choices we made although the poached egg is still far from world standards. The coffee is good. A glance at the drinks list reveals another surprisingly wide range of whiskeys, cocktails and beers. A bit hidden from the main road but a definite gem if you are looking to chill in a unique and cool environment amidst good beverages and decent food

Why I'm only the 2nd reviewer I have no idea. Perhaps everyone already knows about TDC judging by the massive line ups every single bloody day. We come here almost religiously whenever we want a quick healthy warm bite to cover off our protein/veggie/ grain needs. Excellent value especially the ribeye add-on.

Upholding the same standards as the other location we've been to, TMP offers a great selection of western and Singaporean dishes (albeit slightly on the pricier side unless you have the Entertainer App like we do) along with a good hotel lobby ambience and friendly staff. Nothing spectacular but fits the bill of a weekend brunch spot with a group of friends in the city core where you don't have to fight for a spot or have a table booked (even on Sundays)

Hands down best cafe to work/study in the Tanjong Pagar area. Located in the lobby of a gorgeous Carlton City Hotel but never super noisy, this Cafe offers reasonably priced selection of drinks and food with easily the friendliest staff you'll ever meet along with free wifi and access to power plugs.

They started the hype and it's probably here to stay. Still one of my favourite go to spots for a healthier lunch option offering a good selection of restaurant level selections for you to mix and match. With the likes of Daily Cut right around the corner though, I would only wish they could lower their price just a bit to contend with the almost negligible difference in quality.

A no funky business self-service bagel
stop serving excellent combinations from basic spreads to heartier multi-topping sorts (think BLT on steroids) at prices that are highly reasonable

Easily my favourite bar in the Tanjong Pagar district.
Good selection of cheap draught beer and bar snacks to wind down with colleagues after a long day in the office. There's a reason this place is packed every weeknight. Guinness pint for $11 without happy hour? Yes please

Ok i admit i am a little hook with their kueh salat especially.  Also tried almost all of their offerings.  I got to say overall the cakes are very nice.  Things are certainly more expensive but really u pay for what u get.  The only thing i would hope for the counter staff should be a little patient and not be too pushy to get the order in.  Do a little bit more of a soft-sell and guide the customer to a selection instead of "come on! Make up your xxxx mind as i got a lot of customer to serve!" and in reality there were no one waiting.

Chili crab pasta ($17++= $20) - 4.5 stars
Huge portion! Lots of fettuccine, and better still ample crab meat and even soft shell crab! Taste was spicy enough to make time perspire but for some reason the flavor was a tad lacking. Not enough for me to complain though.

I love the decor here - the spacious minimalist interior and huge windows! Coming back for sure.

Lava cake', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Lava cake'}]
text:
A quiet and affordable cafe to chill at/study especially on a weekday! Check out their set lunch/students deals or their occasional fave vouchers which make their meals really value for money :)

Had the aglio olio with tiger prawns while my friend had the chicken steak aglio olio. I'd recommend just getting the original one without prawns or get the chicken one if you're a fan of chicken. The chicken aglio olio comes with a generous serving of chicken chop, while the prawn one was served with three small prawns at the side. Though it's listed as "tiger prawns" on their menu, it did not taste much different from the frozen prawns you'd get from the supermarket. 

The coffee here is average, and better options are available in the vicinity with the wide array of cafe choices in the Somerset/orchard area!

Overall, worth visiting if you happen to be nearby/come around during lunch hours/are a student!

text:
Bought a box of the new Thé Noir tea infused chocolate cookies ($14 for a box of 10) for my friend who was meeting me for lunch at Japan Food Town and also a box of ironai cheese cookies/langue de chat au fromage ($12 for a box of 9) for my sister. 

The staff was friendly. I guess the pricing of the product is reasonable.

LeTAO is supposedly famous for their cheesecake, specifically the Double Fromage made with imported Italian mascarpone cheese. Since they do not sell by slices, it would be too much for me to buy the whole cake and share with my mom. So I have to pass. Hopefully someone I know will get to try and let me know how it is. 

LeTAO at Ion Orchard is the flagship store in Singapore. The stand alone counter is located at B1 right outside Lululemon or Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf.

text: For a visiting tourist I would maybe slightly edge this place as it's charming, it's located within Chinatown. The other would be killiney kopitiam on killiney rd which is more for locals. To be honest ya kun is my favorite but this place is good too.

The Ethos, Strangers at Work", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The Ethos, Strangers at Work'}]
text:
Having been to all the coffee shops in this area for the past 2 years, I can unequivocally say these guys do the best coffee.

It's consistent, high quality, and the team have friendly charm to put a bounce in your step and send you on your way.

Oh yeah - they also do a killer vegemite & cheese toastie - so as an Aussie I'm now completely committed to this as my #1 coffee stop!

text: A small cafe that serves really good desserts for a reasonable price. We got many of their tarts to share. No complaints at all. What makes the difference (to me) is that the tart shell is perfect in thickness, crispness and butteriness.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lgoiiKQ2SZcs1N0w4Z8npA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=rqVKoKwqp1pzY0eyYVOMvA&select=lgoiiKQ2SZcs1N0w4Z8npA', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore. Smoked beef bagel. Don&#39;t remember the actual name.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Smoked beef bagel. Don't remember the actual name."}]
text:
Let's face it, bagels for $10 in Singapore is like chicken rice for £30 in London. You have to make sacrifices if you're not eating local specialties. 

Once I got over that, it was great. Every choice so far has been done perfectly, the bagel toasted yet soft, the ingredients top quality. The smoked beef one is particularly good, although being able to go and buy a decent smoked salmon bagel in Singapore still remains one of my favourite discoveries in the relative food desert of Tanjong Pagar. 

The filling is generous enough that these days we split one between two, but we're not big eaters. Service is fast and friendly.

So far the best hawker centre ever with great food and hospitable vendors. I'm just so glad that some of my favourite stall are not pushed aside after the renovation. 

If you're coming here, I'd recommend you to try out the following 

- Beef noodle. It's quite obvious there as it is the only one, just walk towards the ban chang kueh stall deep inside the hawker centre

- Ban chang kueh beside beef noodle. It's really good and they are still doing it old-fashioned style which I personally prefer over Mr Bean's

- Nonya cake shop, located beside the kway chap stall. Near to beef noodle shop, try to spot the bright white neon sign. 

- Tiong Bahru Pau. You would spot this easily as they're the only store to occupy two stalls at the left of the escalator. Queue early in the morning as they're usually sold out by 11 am. 

- Prawn Noodle. It's located somewhat near the toilet, you'd definitely spot it since it has a long queue

- Oyster Omelette beside the famous pork rice. The stall is manned by a very nice and chatty uncle. Although I couldn't really speak chinese, he still tries to relate to me, something I don't really experience in Singapore anymore. The food itself is really good too! Large, fresh oyster was used and the sambal was very fragrant. 

- Char Kway Teow. This is the legendary stall, located to on the left when you come up from the escalator. Try to spot the orange store sign and long queue and voila you arrive at the correct stall. While it is very oily (by very I really do mean it), it has that wok hei that no food court has managed to replicate. It is truly a definitive mark of an experienced cook. 

I'm pretty sure there are many others stall that are just as good but I may not spot it yet. The above are just a snippet of my suggestion if you're crunched for time yet want to experience Tiong Bahru Market.

A very nice interior drew us there for brunch.

Alas it does not make up for eye watering prices and practices such as not offering ice water (instead, you have to pay for your water) and a 2 hour then return the table policy.

Portion size was small, which was expected, but the food was average, which was unexpected given the popularity and look of the place. The avocado chunks were literally black in half the cases - not just lightly oxidised but thoroughly black throughout - no self respecting chef would have served that. The hummus lacked salt. The $10 grapefruit juice they call a "no-tail" was not really worth it. The cocktails looked better. We walked on to Common Man to top up the calories despite spending over $100++, rather than try the desserts.

I recognised a few people from the hip crowd (including a Vogue cover). For some reason this place is "cool" right now, perhaps the great interior which beats the usual drab school chairs and tables with raw concrete, perhaps the fans which make the heat bearable, perhaps the lack of options nearby. Tables are very close together and the one next to us was quite interested in our conversation.

Free the robot signature ($6+)', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Free the robot signature ($6+)'}]
text:
A comfortable cafe with all the vibez on point. It has a rustic hippie feel with darker benches near the entrance and beautiful sunlight (perfect for that gram!) For the bar seats. 

While the atmosphere did not disappoint, their signature free the robot coffee did not impress. While the cold one had a decently even taste of coconut-reminding you of ondeh ondeh-throughout, the hot version was, as mentioned by another foodie, but a normal cuppa with a layer of coconut oil floating on top. 

What was bad was their vanilla coffee, which did not blend at all with their beans and left a rather pungent taste in the mouth. My food buddy even found a piece of paper in her drink, which was honestly unacceptable. 

What made the visit rather unpleasant was the staff which kept hovering around our seats and were swift to clear our cups even when the cafe was rather empty. That being said, credit must be given for their somewhat enthusiastic service. 

Overall, a place worth a visit. Whether it warrants a trip back depends on your personal preference! I'd say no for the coffee, but I haven't tried the food so that might make up for it. There's also a really cute dog named Baileys there on most days!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/1iEEs57kwRs2WD5xSX6ZQQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/five-foot-way-coffee-and-juice-bar-singapore?reviewid=okS8cdzD1yik3IPXS3IXGA&select=1iEEs57kwRs2WD5xSX6ZQQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Five Foot Way Coffee & Juice Bar - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5hTc-unDbQ36sJAGmP7dJg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/five-foot-way-coffee-and-juice-bar-singapore?reviewid=okS8cdzD1yik3IPXS3IXGA&select=5hTc-unDbQ36sJAGmP7dJg', 'altText': 'Photo of Five Foot Way Coffee & Juice Bar - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
The cafe was located at the first floor of the building, with dine in area spread around. After placing order at the cashier, one proceed to the collection counter to collect drinks. A pager was given which would light up when food is ready for collection.

Shepherd Pie ($9.90)
Available in both beef and chicken.
Served with a glass of iced lemon tea.
Only chicken version was available when I placed order. It was served pipping hot. Tasted not bad although I heard that the beef version was better.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=7XTmpN6INyLuuWAP6FF9sQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gSxY2xGFXOKp2lfGkNrGbA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gSxY2xGFXOKp2lfGkNrGbA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gSxY2xGFXOKp2lfGkNrGbA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gSxY2xGFXOKp2lfGkNrGbA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gSxY2xGFXOKp2lfGkNrGbA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gSxY2xGFXOKp2lfGkNrGbA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Rachel T.', 'displayLocation': 'Bukit Timah, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Rachel T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=7XTmpN6INyLuuWAP6FF9sQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 74, 'photoCount': 37, 'reviewCount': 15, 'eliteYear': None}
photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kR65OFlz8yRWzz3BAF9VCg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/plain-vanilla-bakery-singapore-3?reviewid=r3HK82NdkD5bDqaLNoqWVQ&select=kR65OFlz8yRWzz3BAF9VCg', 'altText': 'Photo of Plain Vanilla Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Purchased $88.00 worth of cupcakes. They got my order wrong, sigh.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Purchased $88.00 worth of cupcakes. They got my order wrong, sigh.'}]
text:
A small, rather cramp space with three small tables. They have proper cutlery. When you takeaway, they won't give you plastic bags, so BYOB - bring your own bags! 

Also, make sure the staff get your order right. I spent $88 on PV cupcakes and they got my cupcake order wrong!

Another great coffee shop in Bukit Timah. Great selection of brewed and espresso coffee. Hot and cold. They also have two selections of nitro brewed coffee. 
What is obvious is how much passion has gone into this shop. Take a look at the hardware that they have installed for roasting and brewing. They are very serious about their Joe.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/F56-n8BdCEdWezMhAF3mvg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/dal-komm-coffee-singapore?reviewid=6vqIgw3a64PAh1EY-uucKw&select=F56-n8BdCEdWezMhAF3mvg', 'altText': 'Photo of dal.komm COFFEE - Singapore, Singapore. Latte + iced mocha', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Latte + iced mocha'}]
text:
Decent coffee, ample and spacious seating, free and fast wifi (+power points for those who need them)... can't ask for much more! Add in the Korean music playing in the background, including familiar osts from the likes of Goblin... I guess that's why I've found myself going back there a couple of times :) 

Dal.komm has a good selection of cakes, none of which I've really tried so I can't give an honest opinion, but the coffee is pretty good. Their sweet drinks (such as their matcha latte) can be too sweet though for some...

Valrhona chocolate and brandy cake ($9) - 3.75 stars
There are chocolate cakes and there are chocolate cakes. This one seems defined by its thick sturdy ganache topping. The cake itself is just as hardy and has the consistency and taste of say the centre of a baba au rhum - it's not a light and fluffy cake or  creamy mousse or a melt in your mouth Sacher torte. It's sort of like a more solid truffle. Anyhow it satisfied my chocolate cake craving, though I could only power through a couple of bites. The brandy is strong enough to give me a bit of a headache...

Caramel shortbread ($4.70)

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/U6yzjkliwtvhOMqzPW3hBw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/verdure-cafe-singapore?reviewid=Ddo-HaJmgp0NNPUwEd8_sQ&select=U6yzjkliwtvhOMqzPW3hBw', 'altText': 'Photo of Verdure Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/cQcg6cPs8S-fawHpmBNBcg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/verdure-cafe-singapore?reviewid=Ddo-HaJmgp0NNPUwEd8_sQ&select=cQcg6cPs8S-fawHpmBNBcg', 'altText': 'Photo of Verdure Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SSxt-Yea2P2Yh_CWbU7iPA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/verdure-cafe-singapore?reviewid=Ddo-HaJmgp0NNPUwEd8_sQ&select=SSxt-Yea2P2Yh_CWbU7iPA', 'altText': 'Photo of Verdure Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Id2KIpckV-1FAtVnvvOgCQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/verdure-cafe-singapore?reviewid=Ddo-HaJmgp0NNPUwEd8_sQ&select=Id2KIpckV-1FAtVnvvOgCQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Verdure Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text:
The place was in the park, hidden by the lalang surrounding it. It was located just a stone throw from the bus stop. There was both outdoor alfresco and indoor air-con dine in area, with the carpark just in front. 

Salted Egg Chicken Burger ($14.90)
Crispy chicken thigh, topped with salted egg sauce, served with salad & fries 
The sauce looked quite thin a layer on the chicken patty but the flavour was most distinct. Can't wondering if the patty had been seasoned in salted Egg.

Black Pepper Smoked Duck Aglio Olio ($14.90)
spaghetti tossed with olive oil, herbs, chilli flakes, garlic, mushroom & black pepper smoked duck 
It was well flavoured without overdosed by black peppe

Chilli Crab Pasta (S$16.90)
spaghetti tossed with chilli crab paste, shredded crab meat & egg 
Those who love love crab but didn't want to dirty fingers would this dish 'cos it was packed with chunky real crab meat. No crab stick here.

Baked Fragrant Rice ($12.90)
mixed grain rice in rich cream with carrots, onion, mushrooms, topped with choice of bacon/ chicken & baked with mozzarella cheese 
Using mixed grain rice, one would think it would difficult to digest. Turned out it was savoury with soft fluffy rice.

Chicken Chop ($14.90)
pan grilled chicken thigh, topped with mushroom slices, served with salad & wedges 
Tender juicy piece of meat drenched in rich sauce 

Mixed Platter For 4 ($18.90)
Chicken winglets & drumlets, chicken strips, sausages wrapped with bacon strips, calamari rings & potato wedges

Truffle Fries ($8.90) 

Salted Caramel Lava Cake ($7.90)
Served with a scoop of ice cream 
Not sure why but felt that the scoop of vanilla ice cream tasted sweeter than the soft moist cake.

Organic Peppermint Leaf Tea (S$5.90)
Origin : Laos
Uses : For indigestion, loss of appetite, stomach discomfort, flatulence, nausea, vomitting, morning sickness, lung infections, liver porblems, gall bladder problems, painful menstrual periods.
It was served in such elegant tea pot with the cup below it, and brown sugar in bottle.

Hibiscus Orange Organic Tea (S$6.90)
Origin : Laos
Uses : For high blood presure, high cholesterol, heart disease, loss of appetite, colds, coughs, irritated stomach, fluid retention, nervous condition. 
The tea was kept warm for quite awhile with a slight floral taste.

Zucchini Refresher ($4.90) 
The drink was refreshing with a cucumber-like taste.

Salted Caramel Latte ($4.90 + $1)
Served in a double-wall glass, with the salted caramel on top.

Fizzling Passionfruit ($4.90)

Raspberry fruit ice ($5.50)

Rose Dale ($6.50)
Milk, soda, ice cream, boba
The drink was milky and carbonated with boba pearls bursting out in the mouth when bitten.

Flat white', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Flat white'}]
text:
I only come here for coffee and the flat white is good. 

I also like the shape of the bottle for the cold brew. Looks like a medicine bottle which is quite cool. 

The place is often busy and crowded. Get a reservation if you are coming in a big group. 

The staff is friendly and the service is on point.

Brownie with vanilla ice cream', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Brownie with vanilla ice cream'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/p0ifY8sVSC95CDLjlErS5w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/wild-honey-singapore-3?reviewid=B_2r7vgxEGdfukynN6rJFQ&select=p0ifY8sVSC95CDLjlErS5w', 'altText': 'Photo of Wild Honey - Singapore, Singapore. Scandinavian', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Scandinavian'}]
text:
Late lunch.. found this place inside the Scott Plaza. 
Surprisingly, it's almost full house at 3pm+. Ordered a cold brew single origin. It was actually quite good, even slightly better than Starbucks and far better than TCC. And the price is reasonable $5.50. 
I ordered the all day breakfast, Scandinavian. Salmon wrapped with asparagus, on top of deep fried thin hash brown (I hope I got it right), drizzled with hollandaise dressing. Sadly, I didn't like it. Not at all. Especially I didn't know what to do with the tomatoes. The deep fried "nest" made of hash brown was very tough and oily, I was slightly worry about it flew out of my plate when I cut it with knife. That would be embarrassing. I didn't finish the main, I thus ordered a brownie with vanilla ice cream. Not bad! Good for sharing. Too much for one person. 
Conclusion, a place good for coffee and dessert.

text: Great service and delicious food. The outdoor seats are pretty chill, great for those who would like to dine outside. Service is attentive and friendly. Enjoyed having brunch there.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=xU3sDPonLx1_w4t6wOOpdg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2tpNJsz2hcEol8OYpL7nSQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2tpNJsz2hcEol8OYpL7nSQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2tpNJsz2hcEol8OYpL7nSQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2tpNJsz2hcEol8OYpL7nSQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2tpNJsz2hcEol8OYpL7nSQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2tpNJsz2hcEol8OYpL7nSQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ting Yi C.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Ting Yi C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=xU3sDPonLx1_w4t6wOOpdg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 30, 'photoCount': 6, 'reviewCount': 194, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Although the place is quite crowded on weekends, the great service and ambience makes up for it! There is not GST/service charge so you pay whatever is on the menu. The outside of the cafe makes for a good backdrop for outfit photos too.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hWm5z3nBb4q6-fuNsyr0kg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-marmalade-pantry-singapore-4?reviewid=gJ0QNboxLIBIRGpLlcknrA&select=hWm5z3nBb4q6-fuNsyr0kg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Marmalade Pantry - Singapore, Singapore. Chocolate pudding with vanilla ice cream ($14)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chocolate pudding with vanilla ice cream ($14)'}]
text:
Aug 2017

Spinach and kale salad ($24) - 3.5 stars
It was nice that they included the salads in the Entertainer promotion but the portion was small. This wouldn't have filled me up as a main.

Beef cheek paparadelle ($26) - 3.75 stars
The beef was soft and tender though it had a bit too much of a gamey taste. Have to agree with my dining companions that the black pepper sauce was a bit odd, like a black pepper beef hor fun and the paparadelle noodles an odd type of kway teow.

Crabmeat pasta ($24) - 4 stars
The pasta was al dente and the sauce was well flavored, though a bit too spicy for me. Good amount of crab as well.

Chocolate pudding with vanilla ice cream ($14) - 3.5 stars
Nice soft chocolate cake but the chocolate flavor wasn't very strong. It was very small. The vanilla ice cream was alright, better than your Walls but not as good as Haagen Dazs.

========================

Jan 2017

Caprese sandwich - 3.5 stars
The mozzarella didn't have much flavor or richness, the basil didn't taste very fresh, and the tomatoes lacked flavor too. The focaccia was good, and the fries were pretty crispy and spicy but I don't like fries much.

The Marmalade Club - 3.5 stars
A little better than the one above because the ingredients were naturally more tasty - egg, ham and I think what was a chicken salad. Came with sweet potato fries, which was a nice addition.

Ambience 3.5 stars
It was a pretty quiet and nice place for lunch but too dim to work at.
Solid coffee in the Outram Park neighborhood. Location is hidden in a HDB block so you definitely need to search for it. Minus one star for limited seating options

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lY14dlY6pk3xCLQ4kphafQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/clinton-street-baking-company-and-restaurant-singapore?reviewid=_CmK5brt5i2T2TGokTWNrg&select=lY14dlY6pk3xCLQ4kphafQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Clinton Street Baking Company & Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Super fluffy pancakes with banana and walnut', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Super fluffy pancakes with banana and walnut'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/q_wnXBrZRxUCwZ3FuAZW_A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/clinton-street-baking-company-and-restaurant-singapore?reviewid=_CmK5brt5i2T2TGokTWNrg&select=q_wnXBrZRxUCwZ3FuAZW_A', 'altText': 'Photo of Clinton Street Baking Company & Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken and waffles', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chicken and waffles'}]
text: Finally, a good American diner style breakfast place in Singapore! The food here is pretty good - I've tried the pancakes with warm maple butter + banana walnut, as well as chicken and waffles. Both were really good! The pancakes were extremely fluffy, and are in my opinion one of the best you can find in here.... and the warm maple butter they're served with was also heavenly!!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8OKfpUJ-5ijBy2sYJopz3Q/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/starbucks-singapore-130?reviewid=IwSDI16DuiaN8ztrgHxVLQ&select=8OKfpUJ-5ijBy2sYJopz3Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Starbucks - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/LrAXfVK_NIQ_zc-Bc80x1g/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/starbucks-singapore-130?reviewid=IwSDI16DuiaN8ztrgHxVLQ&select=LrAXfVK_NIQ_zc-Bc80x1g', 'altText': 'Photo of Starbucks - Singapore, Singapore. Matcha earl grey jelly frap', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Matcha earl grey jelly frap'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yza7V7jHEfqxPKP7FI7o2w/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/starbucks-singapore-130?reviewid=IwSDI16DuiaN8ztrgHxVLQ&select=yza7V7jHEfqxPKP7FI7o2w', 'altText': 'Photo of Starbucks - Singapore, Singapore. Ovaltine chocolate cake', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Ovaltine chocolate cake'}]
text:
Awesome service by the staff here. I was looking for the Starbucks keycharm (out of stock at several outlets I went to) and the staff offered to take my contact details and call me once the stock arrive (targeted to be a few hours later). She did call me the same evening letting me know it has arrived. Kudos to that. 

The place is spacious and gets crowded often. The drinks and food are usual Starbucks standard.

Chinatown Complex: grungy, unbearably hot, dirt cheap...and yet awesome food. 

This is definitely a local's style food court upstairs in a sprawling ugly concrete building above a  market in Chinatown.  We went for breakfast a couple times since we were staying across the street and they have pretty much everything you could want.  Mainly there for Bedok chee kueh (google "chee kueh", and then go try some) and it didn't disappoint. Look for the stall right by the escalators to the left.   

We also ran into an enthusiastic local, who told us the soy sauce chicken stall here is actually better than the Michelin starred one across the street, which was a nice little tip.  Satay available later on in the day, but the famous Tian Tian fish porridge stall way in the back is open early.  And popiah.  So much goodness in one place!  There's even a craft beer stall (this place is actually becoming hipsterfied?).

Valrhona chocolate cake ($9.01 on Honestbee) - 4.5 stars Good cake! They're right it's best served at room temperature. Fish and chips - 3 stars Too salty! But I ate this a couple hours after so maybe it would've tasted less salty had I eaten it fresh...? I got this via Honestbee delivery (honestbee.sg/r/NICOLAL53… for $10 off) and have to go down to the store to try their other cakes and food!

Soba + tuna + beets & carrots + bean sprouts & cucumbers + snap peas ($16) - 2.5 stars
I like the idea but it is pretty pricey and everything was too salty unfortunately! Not terribly impressed.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DjbSOaasUwCgmkjP4TOd_w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coconut-club-singapore?reviewid=h0h-q8Q1zdTqFPyFNkekAQ&select=DjbSOaasUwCgmkjP4TOd_w', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coconut Club - Singapore, Singapore. Nasi lemak and iced lemongrass drink', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nasi lemak and iced lemongrass drink'}]
text:
This is my go to place for delicious nasi lemak. 

The rice is really infused with coconut flavor and is not overly strong. The flavor also does not taste synthetic like some other places. 

I will suggest to just get the nasi lemak and maybe a lemongrass drink. That is light and refreshing. 

The nasi lemak comes with sambal (not too sweet or spicy), fried egg with runny yolk (not all the time), cucumber, crunchy ikan bilis and peanuts and two pieces of fried chicken. The fried chicken is yummy, the best thing next to the rice. 

The side dishes are ok, not that special or fantastic to warrant the prices. Same for the desserts. 

It gets crowded fast, so you will only be seated if everyone is your group is there.
Love, love love the bubble tea here and so do many others as the line is always long.  They have every type of tea you can imagine.  Great location.

Great choice for affordable healthy lunch. They aren't crowded during lunch either! I always go for the comfort fix (chicken thigh, onsen egg, broccoli and brown rice) and its filling enough that I ask for less rice.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=bTS3MDcJOUEDi70jiAOYfw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2KJcXcIQXz7dpFj7TGq88w/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2KJcXcIQXz7dpFj7TGq88w/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2KJcXcIQXz7dpFj7TGq88w/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2KJcXcIQXz7dpFj7TGq88w/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2KJcXcIQXz7dpFj7TGq88w/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2KJcXcIQXz7dpFj7TGq88w/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Greta S.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Greta S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=bTS3MDcJOUEDi70jiAOYfw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 27, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 6, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great coffees, nice brunch options and the ambience at the place was very cosy too. Keep it up.

Double chocolate muffin ($3.30) - 4.5 stars
Moist and they warmed it up. Delicious!! Everything I want in a chocolate muffin.

Skinny hot chocolate ($6.50) - 2.5 stars
It's not very rich, maybe because of the low fat milk... Made from Ghirardelli chocolate syrup so they can't remove the sugar.

Nice ambience! Good place to read or chat.

text: Probably a good thing for my waist line that  I found this spot on my last day in Singapore.  The salted caramel chocolate tart (gluten free) paired extremely well with my iced coffee.  The flavors were well balanced, rich, but somehow not too sweet.  They also had savory buttery crusted pies and other delicious items to choose from. You can take items to go or eat in.  The space was a needed respite after a long day on my feet.  Very cozy and somewhat darkened interior, delicious food at decent prices, and friendly staff.  You order upfront and pay at the cash register. Take a number and find a seat.  The food is then delivered to you.   Exactly what the doctor ordered.
