Free Maison jars with cold coffee drinks', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Free Maison jars with cold coffee drinks'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zZhUPogimdoNWopbgGMv3A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hot-singapore-2?reviewid=aHaIMY6eXQ6mqbixVWOGeQ&select=zZhUPogimdoNWopbgGMv3A', 'altText': 'Photo of HOT - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: HOT stands for House of Taste.  Coffee by day, after work watering hole by night. The space is uniquely shaped, and small, but they have done a good job of maximizing the seating area.   The interior design is industrial modern and very cool.  They are known for their single origin specialty coffee.  There will always be something new to taste or smell here as they change their coffee bean selection regularly.  They always have 3 options of beans to choose from.  Depending on how you want your coffee - espresso style, or V60 pour-over.  All their coffees are served double shot.   There is also a selection of tees, cold-pressed juices, and aloe vera drinks.  They also had a selection of deserts, in house made sandwiches, and yoghurt-granola jars. The menu can be overwhelming for a first timer like me, but the staff were extremely friendly and helped walk me through my options.  They suggested that I try an iced coffee latte.  It was refreshing, flavorful,  and served in a mason jar that is yours to keep (included in the price). Quality coffee at decent Singaporean prices.  I wish my hotel was near this spot as I would have come back here several times during my trip if I could.

We absolutely loved Lau Pa Sat... it's a hawker centre, so don't expect frills, and has been refurbed...

The food is simply amazing here - you can pretty much get whatever you want...  we opted for Indian Vegeterian, some fresh juices and some amazing pastries...

Three Ganga's Onion Rava Masala Dosa is absolutely delicious! :-)

All fabulous - highly recommended... ignore the drivel that people have posted saying it's a tourist trap - whilst it is becoming more touristy, we wouldn't go as far as to say to avoid it and it's a tourist trap... you will love it...

text: I love this place. The food is tasty and of great quality. It's my go-to place for weekday takeouts. Also, the manager of this place is a nice guy - he walked me through a process of how they marinate the meats, prepare pickled veggies and etc. Recommended!

The inside layers of the Thai Basil Mango Mousse ($7.80). Highly recommend', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The inside layers of the Thai Basil Mango Mousse ($7.80). Highly recommend'}]
text:
Unique dishes with a local twist. Abundant seating. Good deals right now through Eatigo (10-50% discount). If you book through Eatigo do note there are two separate menus and seating for Coalesce Dining vs. Coalesce Bar. 

Waited 45 minutes for one order (Bar Sampler) which was small and expensive for its full price ($35). The pumpkin wontons were fine but again very small. The Thai Basil Mango Mousse was the highlight of the night, excellent balance of flavours.

Minus one star for long wait time for order to arrive. Another minus one star for portions that are small for their value.

text:
3.5 stars at first, but I decided to minus 0.5 star when I looked at the waitresses' face. Lol.. call me mean .... but walking into a cafe/ restaurant on Saturday afternoon, I expected a warm welcome especially when you are not charging $2 for a cup of coffee but in the range of $6 to $9 ... I am not saying that they are rude or what, but they showing blank face, not even smiling. To me, they don't enjoy what they are doing at all. 
Alright, back to the food. I ordered a premium French toast set, come with a drink (you can choose from the list), it costs $17.90. Not a bad deal at all. 
The French toast came with blueberry sauce (they have 3 choices mango, blubbery and ... sorry I can't remember), topped with a vanilla ice-cream. It is good, but nothing fantastically impressive. I paired the pancake with hot soy latte. Pretty good. 
The place is not crowded, good place for friends gathering. And they do serve wines too. 
I will consider come here again, for the coffee. 

Cheers!

text: Nice place and decor. Relaxed atmosphere. However, staff is not very attentive - no cutleries, courses including ice-cream was served at the same time as main course, food was served before drinks, ice-water served only upon request. Quality of food - 6/10. Croissant served cold - not warmed up. Staff rather inexperience but polite. Politeness: 7/10.
Salmon Rosti and French toast were delish! I will be back to try the dirty burger and the beers on tap!

text: Good food. Nice ambience. The service staff are efficient, informative and accommodating. The food is a decent standard - value for money. Hope they will have more variety in the choices of food available for after Brunch Hours. Place is ideal for a private event.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=YQ6MAHSW4jTAzGRUvio1yA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Boris P.', 'displayLocation': 'Manhattan, NY', 'altText': 'Boris P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=YQ6MAHSW4jTAzGRUvio1yA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 7, 'reviewCount': 47, 'eliteYear': None}
text:
I don't think I can add much to all the reviews here.

If you've never had a bagel, this is probably a rather overpriced experience, but if you cherish the memory of a deliciously crisp and chewy bagel with cream cheese, lox or pastrami, then this is one of the only good places that serves up a taste of New York.

I think the pastrami here isn't quite as good as the only other place I've found with good bagels here (Sacha & Sons), but it's still pretty decent. The bagels themselves are, of course, amazing.

I like their non-pretentious attitude here - they allow you to bring whatever drinks you want to accompany your bagel (in fact, they helpfully suggest that the Cold Storage opposite has chilled wine for sale). I've never seen that level of hospitality elsewhere. Kudos to them!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=YQ6MAHSW4jTAzGRUvio1yA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Boris P.', 'displayLocation': 'Manhattan, NY', 'altText': 'Boris P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=YQ6MAHSW4jTAzGRUvio1yA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 7, 'reviewCount': 47, 'eliteYear': None}
text:
Honestly not sure what the fuss is about.

Saw decent crowds in the cafe, so I decided to try it some time. 

Their brunch menu is pretty standard for a cafe (no proper kitchen, so everything is toasted or pre-made) - waffles, toast, granola, salad, etc. I ordered a Croque Monsiere (ham and cheese on toasted bread) and a matcha milk.

The Croque Monsiere was decent, but nothing to shout about. The matcha milk was pretty good (very lightly sweetened and not bitter). 

However, the cafe itself was small and seating was not cozy, which takes away from the experience. When I'm paying cafe prices, I expect it to be nice, intimate and cosy. It wasn't. They also don't accept credit cards, which is not really acceptable for the kind of food and prices they charge.

I've heard their cold brew coffee is good - I'm not a coffee person, so I can't judge that. But based on everything else, I don't think I would go back.

text: These tarts were a gift from a good friend. They must be one of the best tarts I ever had in a while. I love the thin buttery crust and the light fillings in each one. The size was perfect for 1 without feeling overly heavy. Each tart had its distinct taste and the ingredients were fresh. Love them!

Have to pour slowly the milk into the bailey iced cube', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Have to pour slowly the milk into the bailey iced cube'}]
text:
Second visit there... love it! The service was warm and sweet. The food was awesome ... the coffee on the rock was mmmmm ... more than words can describe. 
I ordered their September monthly special, firey crab aglio oglio... it was good! The taste of the fresh crab meat blended in the pasta ... I think the chef cooked the pasta with the crab meat soup. It was really good! And their bailey coffee on the rock,  it's superb as usual. 
It is a good place to catch up with friends.

What a classy tea shop,  great tea selection, not inexpensive but worth every penny.  Their macaroons are to die for, so many delish flavors and they always look so good displayed in their window.  Service is always courteous and friendly.
Cool little place to have lunch or a snack while strolling around the Botanic Gardens.  Good variety of options to choose from and a good place to get out of the heat and humidity and cool off.

Still feel the same about nanyang coffee. But hey there's one decent dish that is edible here when you're too lazy to get out of biopolis - chicken cutlet with hainanese sauce! 

The chicken cutlet is relatively crispy, in oddly huge chunks. The rice is boring and of short disintegrating grains but well, the hainanese style tomato sauce is too sweet to go without any carbs. Some frozen peas and carrot cubes to pretend as vegetables on the dish. That's all you get! For $5.50 with rice, that's a reasonable price in biopolis. 

Do I crave it? Not really. But at least there's something edible when I'm forced to head there with colleagues.

text:
The espresso here is top notch, one of the best in town for sure. Waffle ice cream dish was good as well although I'm not a fan but it's a 10 min prep. Honestly i wish I ordered the hot cake variety as they peak my interest. It's a 40 min wait. Next time come with people with patience...
Venue typical Instagram hipster joint. Nice vibe.

text: We stopped for a quick lunch - very nice ambience next to the riverside. While the chicken Milanese wrap was good, the pan seared salmon was just average..if you want a late lunch/brunch with a good view, you may consider this..

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/g1BN7UL2JNbuwzDgHLo8mg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hattendo-cafe-singapore?reviewid=d2xS4Dcc5NWvDrZQU5s_zQ&select=g1BN7UL2JNbuwzDgHLo8mg', 'altText': 'Photo of Hattendo Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
Surprisely for a Sunday afternoon, the place was pretty crowded. The female manning the cashier was working half heartedly. One could see that she had already to leave as her friends were waiting for her to knock off from work. She kept interrupting the staff in the kitchen, whom one could see having problems keeping an eye on the stove through the open kitchen. One could not help but notice that he had thrown what was on the pan to the bin. For an order of french toast, I had waited almost 30 minutes for it.

French Toast($9.00)
Selected custard bun for the dish, which was pan fried with slightly top and bottom. It was served with pieces of fruit such as lemon, kiwi, blue berries, orange and strawberries, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream by the side. The caramelised crust of the bun gave a different feel to the bun.

Topup $2.50 for a cup of hot tea to go with it.

text: My favorite milk tea place in sg. I have tried Liho (large cup), everyone each cup (no much tea flavor), Koi (very creamy), etc. this is really the best shop with strong tea flavor but not lack of good milk. I have to stop by Ghoby Gaut MRT just to buy this.

October 2018

Soy latte - 4 stars
Still good thankfully!

French toast ($18) - 1 star
The toast was burnt and wasn't sweet at all (good or bad depending on your taste). The lemon curd and mascarpone were too dense and seemed to come straight out of a jar/tub. An unimpressive overpriced dish.

=============================

2017

Pear and almond slice ($6.20) - 3 stars
Bit too sweet and the crumbly bits, well, crumble.

Hot chocolate - 2 stars
Too sweet. Tastes like it's from a Swiss Miss packet.

Soy latte - 4 stars

Pancakes ($17) - 3.75 stars
The pancakes themselves aren't great - they're a bit too dense and gummy unlike the fluffy Clinton St ones. But they more than make up for it with their incredible toppings! Caramelized bananas, apples, Greek yogurt, toasted almonds and toffee! Absolutely divine and puts the Clinton St ones to shame (I don't like the greasy maple butter they come with and there just aren't enough of the berries they come with). The best part is that the toffee isn't sickly sweet. I'd have to get a large cappuccino instead of the regular to wash this down the next time.

Scrambled eggs ($14) - 1 star
Overpriced, and there were shells in the eggs! Unacceptable really.

Ambience - 4 stars
They have wifi. Plus I love how it opens at 6.30am.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/pYtfS86SRbBn54-z1s6P1g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/bread-and-hearth-singapore?reviewid=KHuH3zISyPXFm41ZgM_S1Q&select=pYtfS86SRbBn54-z1s6P1g', 'altText': 'Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Croissant', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Croissant'}]
text: I was staying down the road and craving some food in the evening, but I felt too lazy to walk far or actually sit down at a restaurant, so I happened upon Bread & Hearth. I had asked for something that they didn't have because it was so close to closing time, so I chose a ham and cheese bread and a focaccia instead. They were delicious! They warmed up the food for me to take back to my hotel, and I also got a free croissant because I had bought 2 breads. Everything was absolutely delicious and the service was prompt and friendly.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EHPu_50hov6aJh7XfQVXFA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=iq_DFn66p2dPvbGu4Uvrbg&select=EHPu_50hov6aJh7XfQVXFA', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. My Awesome Salad', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'My Awesome Salad'}]
text: I had what was probably the greatest salad ever here. My Awesome Salad is packed with proteins (smoked salmon, chicken, ham) and it comes with half an avocado and a bread with pesto. It was so good because it had everything I love on a salad (meat)! The price would be a bit steep for a salad, but since it has that much meat on it I was willing to pay the price. I went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't crowded at all and I didn't feel too awkward because there were other solo diners there besides me. It's a nice casual spot to get something good to eat.

text:
In the heart of Rangoon, more famous for bak kut teh, is this hidden gem of a cafe. It has a laid back hippy charm and the service is very good. Unusual nowadays for cafes to have table service but it works for me and I will come back for sure. Special kudos with their Halloween menu and decorating the place so well.

Tip: they also bake their own bread which they provide to taste for free!

Kopi milo - a mix of the west and the local. Nice smooth coffee that wasn&#39;t too acidic. $0.50 more for ice!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Kopi milo - a mix of the west and the local. Nice smooth coffee that wasn't too acidic. $0.50 more for ice!"}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/O1v9Zv8O3hulaDgRzQUGFg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/keong-saik-bakery-singapore?reviewid=Yx19z_TOaBEeqJB3Tb3Ung&select=O1v9Zv8O3hulaDgRzQUGFg', 'altText': 'Photo of Keong Saik Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. XO Lap Cheong Bun was very tasty. Get the staff to heat it up for you! Not too sweet a dough and savory Lap Cheong for flavor', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'XO Lap Cheong Bun was very tasty. Get the staff to heat it up for you! Not too sweet a dough and savory Lap Cheong for flavor'}]
text:
Finally got an excuse to visit Keong Saik Bakery. Their signature products Sor Hei and green egg bun is gone by 5pm on a Saturday, so I went for a savory option - XO Lap Cheong Bun ($2.30). 

The owner kindly offered to heat it up and yes, there is no other way you should have the XOLCB. The outside of the bun was crispy with the cheese and caramelized edges and the inside was soft and chewy. The lap cheong gave amazing umami flavor and I really liked that the dough wasn't sweet. 

The owner kindly explained that the coffee was roasted rustica beans (didn't mean much to the non coffee connoisseur) and prepared in shots. Milk were frothed the western way and su su meant condensed milk was added. 

The Kopi milo iced($3.80), less sweet, was perfect on a late afternoon. The ice didn't dilute my coffee but cooled it enough I didn't feel like I was boiling in the hot weather. I liked the coffee flavor, not too dark but not too milky. I didn't really taste milo though, but i still really enjoyed the taste. I was very pleased that the coffee wasn't too acidic and I'm not suffering gastric discomfort (that I often do when I drink non cold brew coffee). 

The cafe was quite quiet at 5-6pm but started to pick up as I was leaving. Good time for a nice catch up with friends! But I felt I was probably too loud for the peace. Most people had take outs when I visited. You can also try samples of their bread as you pay at the cashier. Longan bread was surprisingly tasty. 

Need a pick me up in the middle of the day? Drop by Keong Saik bakery for a snack and ang moh coffee done local style with local prices. Very nice coffee and I'll be back for more!

Flat white", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Flat white'}]
text:
A comfortable, quiet cafe with the best coffee you can get! Ordered the flat white ($5.50 before gst) and was not let down by the smooth coffee which was not acidic and pleasant to the taste buds. Other special drinks include the mocha chai and their cold brew.

No service charge but excellent service.
Probably could be considered a high end food court. Nice variety, from local to seafood to Western/European  selections. Slightly pricey but its still good value.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/W7ilk4JRA6mFRTdFwIQJoQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/apiary-singapore?reviewid=DOTndIktOeeJp4Z4FKMGvw&select=W7ilk4JRA6mFRTdFwIQJoQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Apiary - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
Craving for some dessert after your dinner around outram area? Scout out this gem amongst the shady looking bars along Neil road! 

I love that apiary has many craft flavors and they rotate often. My favorite is definitely black sesame, featured in my post. Not too sweet, just the right amount to end the night. It was pretty funny that the cone was sweeter than black sesame when I tried it another time, so that's probably not a combi you'd want. Other interesting flavors are uji matcha, blue milk, Ferraro roche. 

In general, apiary ice cream is the smooth kind. So if you like more texture in your ice cream, they have very few flavors with nuts and crunch added. 

There are some tables around for you to enjoy your dessert and hang out with friends. Probably enough to fit 15 or so people so it does get a little crowded on weekends. 

Bring your cash or nets. No credit cards accepted here!

text:
This is a really beautiful cafe/bistro. I had an affogato. The espresso is seriously good and goes perfectly with the gelato. I noticed they had AeroPress coffee too, which makes me happy as a coffee aficionado. 

I'm a snob when it comes to fries (I'm Belgian, so I have to be a snob about frites) but the truffle fries here were decently good. The mayonnaise they came with was really good. 

A friend had the savory?? hotcakes which looked amazing. We did have to wait quite a long time for them, but we're a patient group. I wanted to try them too but I didn't because I was too full. Next time!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SJs-PXGa2jCxVBGKj76IrQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-lobby-lounge-singapore?reviewid=DtIlGXPlGSAR7WjLvKfhLQ&select=SJs-PXGa2jCxVBGKj76IrQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Lobby Lounge - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mGHQRmlrVAyj71cUXpaQsA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-lobby-lounge-singapore?reviewid=DtIlGXPlGSAR7WjLvKfhLQ&select=mGHQRmlrVAyj71cUXpaQsA', 'altText': 'Photo of The Lobby Lounge - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mfq9sw4E0toY65bsWODklQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-lobby-lounge-singapore?reviewid=DtIlGXPlGSAR7WjLvKfhLQ&select=mfq9sw4E0toY65bsWODklQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Lobby Lounge - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PS-zbmDCx5b2N4KHukFgqA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-lobby-lounge-singapore?reviewid=DtIlGXPlGSAR7WjLvKfhLQ&select=PS-zbmDCx5b2N4KHukFgqA', 'altText': 'Photo of The Lobby Lounge - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text:
The Lobby Lounge was located just at the main lobby, overseeing the swimming pool. It offered Local Lunch Semi Buffet (S$45++) with a choice of main and free flow of selected drinks, as well as, Local 3-tier After Tea (S$30++).

For the 6 of us, we were showed to a table with 2 comfy sofas. 

The choices for the main are : Bak Chor Mee, Hainanese Chicken Rice, Katong Laksa, Prawn Noodle Soup, Fish Bee Hoon Soup, Chili Crab and Mantou. We selected all except for the laksa.

Fish Bee Hoon Soup 鲜鱼米粉汤 (S$24++)
The key ingredient in this dish is the giant snakehead. Here the restaurant used Hamachi made in the traditional way, where deep-fried fish bones are put on a rolling boil for hours to form the soup base. A touch of X.O. brandy is added to elevate the hearty and milky broth without any evaported milk - an original recipe by Ka Soh Restaurant.
It was my favourite. The soup was rich and creamy, full of flavours. It was served with deep fried pork lards by the side.

Prawn Noodle Soup 虾面汤 ($26++)
Mr Lee Pi Duan arrived from Nan'an (Fujian Province) in 1928 and started selling prawn noodles without knowing that one day his family will run nearly all the most popular noodle shops in Singapore. The version here closely resembles the Beach Road Prawn Mee version, run by Lee's eldest son, John.
The Prawn Noodle Soup was served with chilli powder by the side. The soup was rich and flavourful, topped with huge pieces of prawns, plus lots of crispy deep fried pork lards in it.

Bak Chor Mee 肉脞面 (S$24++)
A luxurious take on Bak Chor Mee, this noodle dish takes its recipe from the signature fish maw soup at Seng Kee Mushroom Minced Meat Noodle. The umami soup broth is brewed from pork bones and dried sole, chock-full of quality threadfin fish maw, minced pork, pork slices, egg and topped with stewed mushroom slices.
Not the usual kind. The soup was flavourful with lots of liao. Best had the soup while it still warm. The taste could be pretty fishy when cold. The noodle itself was a bit of a let down.

Hainanese Chicken Rice 海南鸡饭 ($20++)
Singapore is the chicken rice capital of the world. Our inspiration for this traditional Hainanese dish is the old-school style of Chef Yong Jia with tender poached chicken. The fragrant rice is cooked in flavoursome chicken stock and spices, and eaten with a piquant garlic chilli sauce.
The chicken was deboned and tender. Personally I like pairing the chicken with the garlic sauce that served with it.

Chilli Crab and Mantou 辣椒螃蟹和馒头 ($26++)
Chilli crabs had humble beginnings at a pushcart along East Coast Road in 1956. Later on, Chef Hooi of Dragon Phoenix Restaurant added sambal and eggs to enrich the gravy, leading to this version of chilli crabs topped with X.O. sauce for an extra kick which we all enjoy today.
The crab had most of its shell removed and easy to handle. The gravy was pretty spicy and went quite well with the crispy mantou that served with it.

Besides the mains, the buffet included a selection of local appetisers and desserts. 
From the dessert table, it served a selection of popular local nyonya kueh in traditional HarriAnns Peranakan style, such as Ondeh Ondeh, Kueh Rainbow lapis, Ang Ku Kueh Mung Bean, Kueh Keledik, Kueh Bugis, Kueh Sago Melaka, Kueh Pink Fairy, Peanut Ang Ku Kueh, Kueh Dadar, Kueh Salat, and Kueh Lavander. My favourite was the Ang Kue Kueh which was pretty small and delicate in texture with very thin skin.

Bubur Pulut Hitam 黑糯米粥 (S$16++)
Black Glutinous Rice Dessert
Sweetened black glutinous rice porridge inspired by HarriAnns, drizzled with coconut milk and served warm. 
The texture was smooth and creamy without too sweet.

Bubur Cha Cha 
The version here was served hot with the soup in a bright pink. It was not too sweet with soft melt in the mouth pieces of sweet potato and chewy bits.

There was also live station at the small stretch of buffet counter. Spring roll and Kueh Pie Tee were freshly made on the spot by the chef. The spring roll was firm while packing lots of liaos inside.

text: A 30 mins wait for the pancake. But quite worth the wait because the pancake is very fluffy and nice. The strawberries and blackberries are very sour. It is good. Friends ordered other pastas and light bites.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Khdou-0HdX9zs2qCm76_fg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=HINPOorVnuimwAk3O2BMsQ&select=Khdou-0HdX9zs2qCm76_fg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore. Teriyaki salmon donburi', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Teriyaki salmon donburi'}]
text:
I had the teriyaki salmon donburi and it was surprisingly delicious. I love anything with runny egg on top, and this one was one of the best I've seen. The salmon was well-cooked and you get a good amount of fish for the bowl. I loved the cucumbers in it as well, and the rice was just the right texture. 

I wish I'd tried the coffee here, because seeing all the other coffees go by me was really tempting.

Teh ice (milk tea)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Teh ice (milk tea)'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jLeleXBD0FzketoO2SJ5BQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=BbfFxWAN3Js6ouWh3cn7WQ&select=jLeleXBD0FzketoO2SJ5BQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Kaya toast'}]
text: I usually go simple at Toast Box with just kaya toast (sometimes with eggs) and a milk tea or kopi. This Toast Box near Esplanade was quite good. The seating area is pretty spacious and the aunties at the counter were soooo friendly to me, which is a step up from other Toast Boxes I've been to. As usual the kaya toast was good for a quick snack and the milk tea is always refreshing.

text:
This is a good place to come for a simple and very affordable meal.

Tried their beef hor fun (more like in soup, not starchy at all thank goodness) - like this very much.

Dry fried beef with hor fun - beef still tender but only 5 slices of beef. I remember the beef hor fun had more slices of beef. Will try that again to verify.

text:
Quite quiet on a Thursday evening. Staff are not really attentive but otherwise friendly and warm when you get their attention. 

Let's talk about the food!
Aglio Olio - I like their version with sun-dried tomatoes thrown in. The pasta by itself is not very tasty but if you put some bits of sun-dried tomato and garlic slices into it, each bite can be quite delightful. This came with 6 juicy plump prawns that went great with the pasta. 

Beef Burger - They asked for the level of "done-ness" and added they only do medium and up. So I clarified that medium rare is no no and waitress repeated "medium and up". So we opted for medium and when the Burger arrived, we were surprised that the patty is very thick and when we cut into it, it was fairly pink. Strange for a 'medium'. 

Smoked Salmon Pizza - Fairly generous with the salmon slices. The pizza was toped with a drizzle of avocado mayo. Interesting combo. My girl liked it enough. 

Pepperoni Pizza - This pizza was really covered with pepperoni slices! With such a generous coverage of meat, how not to be nice? 

Tiramisu - Quite a decent bowl of "yummy"! Really quite a good serving of tiramisu, not too dry nor wet, with loads of cheese. 

Can come back again!

text:
This place is so adorable. We arrived pretty late at night and I was surprised to see diners dressed up in what appeared to be Harry Potter cosplay - but no, the cafe has outfits that you can wear to get in the spirit of things! The decor is so cute and very appropriately Hogwarts-like. Had I come in the daytime, I think the natural lighting would have made for some amazing pictures. 

We got the butterscotch ale, and though I've never been to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter, my friend who has said it tasted JUST like the butterbeer you can find there. It was delicious. 

The food was surprisingly good for a theme cafe. We got the confit chicken with pesto spaghetti and the pesto mayo pork ribs. Both were really well cooked, not too much pesto on either but enough to give you a could flavor. The pork ribs were super tender and the sides that came with it were delicious, very American-style like mashed potatoes and sweet corn. I loved it and that's coming from an American mashed potato addict. 

The witch's brew, although I didn't try it, seems like it's something you can't miss here. I was excited to see another diner get it, and the flaming drink looks exactly like a potion from Harry Potter. If I have one regret it's not trying that!

text: Quite a central location at Novena although slightly off the beaten track as it's at Goldhill Plaza rather than within the malls. Relaxed ambience with good value for money breakfast and sandwiches. I had the lychee mint tee because it was a hot day-that was a disappointing small glass which barely quenched my thirst. Maybe I should have ordered coffee.

text:
Food is terrible. Had the spaghetti Bolognaise. Comes served in throw away or takeaway plastic box sitting atop the noodles below. Doesn't taste good at all.

Then have to get own cutlery and napkins.

Then have to throw everything into the bin on the way out.

No service and spaghetti bolognaise was $25++. Duh!

text:
From 5 October to 31 December 2017, the cafe was reopened as a Miffy character pop up cafe. Besides food, the cafe also offered Miffy products for sale. There was a 10% service charge and only cash and NETS was accepted for payment. Ice water was not served here.

Miffy Hot Latte ($8.90++)
Handcrafted and brewed to perfection from Premium UCC Japanese Coffee Beans.
The drink looked quite cute with sugared ears but tasted average.

Miffy Hot Chocolate ($8.90++)
Kumoya's popular Belgium Hot Chocolate served with a cute floating Miffy Marshmallow.
Another expensive but tasted average drink.

Splashing Good Fun Japanese Seafood Curry Rice ($24.90++)
Fluffy Miffy Japanese rice served with fish kamaboko, cheese stars, steamed broccoli, breaded calamari, breaded ebi, breaded scallop and fresh tempura salmon in Japanese curry. 
The breaded seafood and tempura were cold and seemed to have been lying for sometimes based on the dryness of the meat. The curry was not served pipping hot.

Matcha Mountain Azuki Shibuya Toast ($23.90++)
Shibuya toast served with fresh churned creamy Hokkaido soft serve, buttery Miffy cookies, fresh matcha cream with fruits, matcha sticks, dango, azuki, crunchy pistachio bits and matcha sauce.
The toast was a bit too crispy and dry as it was a bit too hard to cut through. The cookies had turned a bit too soft and not too fresh. The dish got quite jelat halfway.

Overall felt that the meal was way too expensive with sub standard dishes.

text:
I grew up in this neighborhood so coming here was like a homecoming of sorts. Where the hardware stores used to be are a slew of hip and happening cafes, bistros and chillax dessert joints. 

Black White Tale's friendly owner is originally from Hong Kong. Taking a less obvious food direction from the cha chan teng,he decided on serving raclette dishes. 

We had a great time and inhaled most of the dishes quickly. Our faves are the gooey Camembert, so shiok burger and the cheese wheel pasta tossed with truffle oil right at the table.

Stopped by early on a Saturday morning to have brunch with friends. It is a small corner location with long tables (i.e. you will probably share with others). I ordered their French toast, and my friends ordered the pork sandwich and Egg benedict. Serving sizes are well portioned and you could share the French toast. 
The location is a brightly lit and a great spot to stop in for early morning brunch. I was happy with the french toast, enough toppings and the bread was amazing. We also ordered a side order of truffle fries, and those were great too. I am not a coffee drinker, so i cant comment on the coffee, but my friends enjoyed the coffee. We were the first group to arrive to the restaurant, and when we were leaving a group of people were starting to wait for a table.

text:
Good quality sandwiches

Ate exactly what we had at their other outlet at Marina Square. Consistently good.

Smoke duck sandwich comes with sourdough, green apple slices, Japanese cucumber, balsamic reduction - yummy! Wish there was more duck but I know duck is expensive and for the price it was sufficient.

Bacon sandwich - crispy bacon, tomato, lettuce, avocado, poached egg (which we mistook for mozzarella), Japanese mayonnaise on sourdough - lots of bacon! Very nice.

Sourdough bread is very nice.

text: Tasty and reasonably priced food. I had the salted egg benedict which was a nice combination of egg, English muffin, kale and prawns. The salted egg's flavour and portion were just right. The portable air conditioner next to our table had a thick layer of dust and the towel-like table cloth had stains. Luckily hygiene of the food was better. Service was good and they accept credit cards which was a nice surprise.

Excellent Hawker center in the CBD.   So many choices.

I really enjoyed a roast pork and rice dish at Chicky Fun.   The pork was moist and had crisp edges.    The food at most of these stalls are about US$3-4 each plate.    

You can pick from juices, dessert, dim sum, Indian, Chinese, Vietnamese, Noodles, Steaks, Soups, etc... 

Great selection.  Great prices.

This is a large hawker center in the Chinatown area.    So many choices.

I got a nice Lychee Juice.   People around me were going crazy for Seafood noodle soup.   The Hainanese Chicken Rice is very popular with many stall offering the dish.   

Most food can be had for less than US$5.   Some as low as $2.5-3, depending on what you want and how much food you want to it.   Usually very busy.

text: Delicious financiers (miniature butter pound cakes).   We tried the Japanese version (pre-packaged) and the freshly baked one from the store (warm, delicious, buttery, bigger).   The taste was buttery, almondy, soft, very enjoyable.   We also got a cake (Mille Crepe) and it was moist and creamy.   Overall a nice stop for sweets.

text: Well.. visited the second time for the cute theme again. Their menu are the same just that the food are being decorated with another theme. Food wise is okay still. Visiting maybe it's just for the theme. Ordered their Smoked Duck Cold Pasta. This time, they also have their merchandise but the plushie was too expensive to get. Just to take nice food photos I guess

text: Visited here for Cosmo cake. It's really unique and beautiful. Really happy. Also ordered their egg Benedict. It's good too. Their chamomile garden tea is still my preferred choice. Once a while having lunch, breakfast or tea here is good ^^ Happy! Down side is this location isn't easy accessible if you doesn't have a car.

text: Line was long but moved fast. $3.50 per and $19.50 for six pieces. The cheese tarts are light and melt in your mouth. The cheese is a little gooey once bitten. It's a perfect accompaniment with tea or coffee. I wish I were able to bring this back home... I am already dreaming of eating more.

text:
The place was pretty crowded for a Sunday morning. Best chop a table first before joining the queue at the counter to place order for food. After placing order, one would be given a buzzer which would light up when food is ready for collection. As for drinks, wait for the staff to call your buzzer number at the counter. Quite messy, so best take a table near the counter. Anyway we get to see the staffs working on our bread.

Steamed Bread Set (S$4.50)
Soft & fluffy warm steamed bread with fragrant kaya butter spread
Served with large hot drink (Kopi/ Teh) and 2 half boiled eggs
The half boiled eggs were cooked just right with the yolks still runny. Nice with just a dash of dark soya sauce and pepper.
I selected Teh C for set which was rich without too sweet.
The bread was soft and moist, with thick layer of spread on top.

Kaya & Butter Bun Set (S$5.50)
Served with large hot drink (Kopi/ Teh)
2 Thick buns with thick layers of spread on it. Although it was just 2 buns, it was quite filling.

It is the Tiong Bahru Food Market so come with a appetite to try the various options available! Along the same row where the infamous Chwee Kuey is, you'll see a family with an old uncle dishing out awesome Char Kway Teow. It's not the best that I've had but it's not bad as a dish to throw into the mix of having your calories smile from all the junk food. Back to Chwee Kuey, it's famous and the consistency of the Kuey is good but it's a tad too oily for me. The chili does have some kick so beware of the generous dollop. Other food to consider: Tiong Bahru Hainanese Chicken Rice & Pork Innard Soup.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/IoymBkZS8VdBvwXu7fIm3Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=gDWErf_MaXW23CTqJ8LDOA&select=IoymBkZS8VdBvwXu7fIm3Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
When you are visiting Singapore, you MUST visit this location.  It is one of the best outdoor food court.  Almost 100 restaurants serving different foods..  I wasn't able to try all but I did try satay.  During the night time, road gets closed and small cart vendors create new few court selling satays.  

I have purchased combo package from street cart which had chicken, beef, and prawns.  So good..  it makes perfect combination with tiger beer...  Beer lady walks around the dining tables and getting orders.

If you are into local food, you need to come.

Be sure to take napkins or wet tissues since you can't find them at any place.  There is a lady who goes around and sells the tissues.

Had come here with a big group for desserts. Got the chocolate lava cake, creme brûlée and bunch of coffees. Was average in terms of the desserts. Have tasted better. Good place to hang out with a group of friends. one of the few places in Singapore where you can actually sit outside without too much discomfort.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-rWXnPhTRIze6eSW__uCOg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/henri-charpentier-singapore-3?reviewid=F-fW3sRb7TebYzYSc690TA&select=-rWXnPhTRIze6eSW__uCOg', 'altText': 'Photo of Henri Charpentier - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bsvezEdagvlp6ET7JexP5Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/henri-charpentier-singapore-3?reviewid=F-fW3sRb7TebYzYSc690TA&select=bsvezEdagvlp6ET7JexP5Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Henri Charpentier - Singapore, Singapore. Left: cheesecake. Right: strawberry shortcake', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Left: cheesecake. Right: strawberry shortcake'}]
text:
Mmm.. the cakes here are delicious. There is very limited seating, about 3-4 tables so we had to get our cake to go. We did manage to find seating elsewhere in the mall.
This is what we had - rare cheese cake. Wow, this was so thick and rich. You won't regret it.
We also had the strawberry shortcake. The sponge was light and fluffy, with layers of sweet strawberry in between. This was topped off with delicious cream.
If you get both, I would recommend eating the strawberry short cake first, because the rare cheese cake will overpower the strawberry shortcake and you won't be able to taste it as much.

text:
November 2017
Tempura fish bowl with quinoa ($16 + $3++) - 3 stars
The quinoa wasn't worth the top up since there wasn't much quinoa. It looked pretty and came with extra greens, but in the end it left me hungry. There was only one large slice of fish.

Soy matcha latte ($5.50) - 2.5 stars
It's been a long while since I've ordered a soy matcha latte (I usually make them at home). It was nice to taste something different but this one tasted a little off somehow. I guess the flavour was too thin.

=============
September 2017
Tempura fish bowl ($16++) - 4 stars
Good! Not amazing though. Not sure if I'd pay the original price.

Pork belly bowl ($16++) - 3 stars
My bad, I'm not a fan of such fatty meat.

Used the offer on chope for one-for-one grain bowls. Have to try the rest of the food!

text:
Located some distance from the main street, the place was a far cry from the busy road. Here one could bring in pets into the cafe. One did not have to worry about own pets doing personal business around the place. The staffs were efficient to handle it easily. The menu covered quite a wide range from bento sets to western main courses to bingsu, as well as, items for doggies.

Duck Leg Confit Aglio Olio (S$18)
Spaghetti, Whole leg confit in its own fats topped, tossed with mushroom ragout and garlicky chilli oil 
The pasta was garlicky with a slight spicy taste. A bit too oily at bottom. The duck leg looked quite dry but the meat was quite tender and not too salty.

Unagi Bento (S$23.90)
Japanese style unagi, basted and grilled with in-house yakiniku sauce and served with rice, tempura prawn & miso soup
I was surprised that the plain looking rice tasted like the chicken rice version of rice. It was garlicky and oily with hints of ginger. The eel was tender and flavourful. The tempura prawn was more like ebi fry as it was covered with crumbs instead of batter. It was light and crispy. 

Cornflake Chicken Cutlet (S$20)
All time favourite!
XXL juicy chicken thigh, coated with cornflake crumbs, honey mustard
Served with coleslaw and wedges 
The serving was huge. Crunchy crispy crusted, inside the meat was thick and juicy.

Black Sesame Bingsu ($14)
Finely shaved ice, topped with black sesame powder, colorful mini mochi balls, and a scoop of  black sesame ice cream.
Unlike the commonly available versions in Singapore, the version served here was not overly sweet, with the tiny mochi balls providing a chewy texture.

If you are bringing your dogs over, don't forget to order items such as 
Furkid's Minced Pupcake ($6.50/ chicken)
Contains carrot, oats, potato, egg

Furkid's Minced Pupcake ($7.50/ lamb)
Contains carrot, oats, potato, egg 

for them.

text: Lau Pa Sat is a great hawker center, but Singapore has so many better options that I always feel a bit underwhelmed by coming here. I always recommend going to the stalls that have a long line and skipping the ones that are actively trying to get you to eat there. If their food was that good, then they wouldn't have to sell you on it :)

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=gMvTe2Vm4-l79jH3apmbog', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jay R.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Jay R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=gMvTe2Vm4-l79jH3apmbog', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 223, 'photoCount': 69, 'reviewCount': 398, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Probably my favorite hawker center in Singapore. I was meeting up with someone here and they were telling me the usual ground rules of "go to the place with the longest lines, cash only, and skip Tian Tian chicken rice." We ended up eating a feast here with chicken rice, fish soup, nasi lemak, BBQ duck, dumplings, oyster cake, and finished it all off with soyabean curd for dessert. Everything tasted amazing and the fact it was all ~$2-3 each probably made me love it even more. I'm glad I went with the recommendation of skipping Tian Tian as Ah Tai tasted 2x better for me. Sorry Anthony Bourdain and Gordon Ramsay, I'm going to have to go with the locals on this one.

Cute place, with pretty desserts but at relatively higher prices (well.. it is at Dempsey). We tried the lemon meringue tart, yummy but $9 a pop!! Perhaps their focus is more on their desserts, their savory menu is really lacking in quality. Service was bad too. Don't think it's worth a second visit. 

Came here on a Friday morning and it was relatively empty. But was surprised that service was still extremely slow. We seated ourselves, the server saw us but did not even approach us and just stood around. We asked for information regarding several things (menu, availabilities etc.), and she had to go ask someone else multiple times - she didn't seem to know what's going on. 

They do not have physical menus, everything is on the iPad. Our party of 4 had to squeeze together to browse a small screen. Their digital menu seems pretty poorly planned out too - they only have brunch items available on weekends and public holidays, but it was featured under their "Popular" section which didn't indicate the availability of the items. New items that were featured on their little posters were not on the iPad and, quote the server, we were supposed to "just order from the iPad", but how?

Food is just ok. They arrived way too slowly... We got appetizers, salad and main dishes. The main dishes came first. We didn't understand why our main dishes came out before the appetizers, and the salad was the last to arrive.

Seems like a cute place to have brunch at, and a nice place to hang after work as it seems like they have live music occasionally. But if the service was already so bad when it wasn't very crowded, can't imagine when it is.

text:
TWG is very old tea house and famous.  They have multiple locations..  This store is located inside the shopping mall next to Marina Bay Sands.   Very small place but have everything to enjoy afternoon tea.  

So many choices of teas to choose..  I took the recommended tea and loved it..  It was summer something (can't remember the exact name).

Price of the tea is not cheap but it will be great experience since they are not instant teas. Relaxing and enjoying the afternoon tea with sweets...  it was very meaningful.  Most of all, my wife loved it..

Streaky Bacon Burger, 2 Blur Guys', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Streaky Bacon Burger, 2 Blur Guys'}]
text:
This burger joint is a solid 3.

Came here for an early lunch and it was already beginning to get busy as we rolled in.

The burger was cooked to medium rare and was quite juicy, and it was a good overall bun-to-pattie ratio, which made for a good experience. I had the prime beef with streaky bacon, which looked to be the best burg on the menu, but unfortunately they snuck some sort of truffle flavour in there (can we stop with that nonsense already???) and there wasn't a good burger sauce to give it a better taste (anything would have helped - BBQ, Tomato, Mustard).

So whilst they have the cooking down, they need to work on the construction of the burger somewhat.

The handful of wedges was a bit meagre and the wait for the food was on the extreme-side. However as there is only 2 guys, that's probably part of the experience, and with it being Singapore, service is never on the awesome-side.

text:
When you are in Dempsey Hill, PS Café is most recommended place to visit for drink, or coffee or light meal or brunch.

It is located little off from the museum, galleries, shops area but distance is walkable.. 5 minutes from shops...

It is not clearly visible from outside but be sure to look for PS Cafe sign.  I think best choice would be to use google map.  I got lost and I got a help from Google Map.   Entrance is like walking into someone's garden..  After 50 ft of walk into forest/garden path, you will see beautiful restaurant/café.

I noticed most of the customer's were foreigners or tourist..  I don't think local people comes here since everything is little pricey.

I love the interior design..  So beautiful.  Very modern looking with classical touches throughout the restaurant.  I wanted to seat outside at the patio but weather was just too hot..  Inside is fully air conditioned.

I visited this location around 3 PM.  It was too early for dinner so I had Lychee drink and cake for dessert...  Chocolate cake was so good.. But taste of coffee was so so...

text:
Delicious pastry..
I have tried many different bakeries and out of all the locations, this is the BEST.

I can't remember the names of the pastries I ate but I have photos..  These are the most popular and best selling items in the store.  Crispy outside and so soft inside...

Also, their coffee is so good..  This is not normal coffee..  Just to give you an idea, Starbucks coffee level 3, coffee from here is level 8.  Coffees are specially brewed by barista to perfection.  It takes time to receive the order but worth it.

I also ordered Ice Chocolate glass bottle drink because I love the bottle...  Not only the bottle looks pretty, taste is even better.  Very deep rich taste.  Employee told me these are made and prepared daily.  Very good but expensive compare to other items..  

Next time, I should try their fresh juice...

text:
I should rate JD a three-star, but the gula Melaka pandan cake won me over to give a 4-star. Also the good service.

The cappuccino is very decent but still not what it should be. What kills a cappuccino is too much milk. I have to ask for less milk, more foam to balance it out.

text:
Having brunch with friend, ordered the famous salted egg yolk crossaint $6.90 and aglio olio with salmon $15.90. The crossaint is good, flowing lava and the portion is big. However, no so much on the pasta as it looks like a mee goreng (Local fried noodle) to me and taste a bit too much peppercorn.
Cappuccino and mocha are just averagely good. Good ambience and friendly staffs, suitable for group catch up.
3.5 stars if you ask me, there is room for improvement. Will come back again in future.

text:
Booked the place for Christmas eve dinner and the restaurant was having Sunday Roast Dinner. There was 3 different dining slots for dinner. I selected the earliest which was 5.30pm and the 2 of us were given the kitchen counter seats where we had a great view of happening in the busy place. Sitting next to us was the head chef's mother who shared with us who was visiting Singapore. Watching the kitchen, I realized the roasted turkey was faster than one usually expected.

We started the meal with 

Pork Terrine (S$15++)
Served with homemade pickles and clementine jam
The light crispy toaste, spread with the chunky terrine, and topped with some pickles such as onion, and beetroot, quite peaked up the appetite. 

Beetroot & Gin Cured Salmon (S$15++)
Served with cucumber potato salad and herb mayonnaise
The salmon tasted just like sashimi that one would not felt that it was cured version.

The meal was followed by huge serving of main courses. 

Roast Beef  (S$25++)
Served with sides of red cabbage, buttered green beans, duck fat fried potato, and bread sauce
While the meat looked rather raw, it sliced easily and tasted delicious. The sides were good too, except for the bread sauce which one felt it was too starchy.

Roast Turkey ( S$25++)
Served with sides of red cabbage, buttered green beans, mashed potatoes , and gravy
One would thought that the meat would be rather tough and dry, but the version here was kind of juicy and went quite well with the light but flavourful gravy. Topped up with the well braised slightly sweet cabbage, it tasted even better.

Accompanied with 
Christmas stuffing (S$3++)
Pork mince, pine nuts and thyme.
I was not a fan of christmas stuffing as I always felt it was rather strong in herbs taste. The version was more like meat loaf with a bit of nutty texture.

Ended the meal with a couple of Christmas cookies topped with cream cheese topping, complimentary from the chef.

text: Not the cheapest of choices but the deserts are of quality. The soufflé is definitely worth the 20 minute wait. Comes out served hot and moist with rich chocolate are ice cream!!! The affogato I had wasn't too bad either. The French manager was friendly and ensured we were liked after. WIR? Yeah if in the area.

text:
Yummy bak chor mee! 

I've also had the laksa here which is decent but the star here is the Bak Chor Mee. The dry version is chocked full of porky flavor goodness. Plenty of ingredients between the the minced pork, sliced pork, pork balls, and braised mushrooms combined with the slightly vinegary sauce. The noodles have a nice bite-back texture and the soup to wash it all down is pretty flavorful too. 

As a bonus, they're open super late so you can fulfill your bak chor mee cravings even at odd hours.

text:
[Directions: Go to Tower 1, then walk around to the left-hand side past Standard Chartered and you will see the LeVeL33 lift]

I'm super-surprised this hasn't been added already to Yelp, with a good 50-100 reviews, as the views of the Singapore skyline from the balcony here are absolutely incredible. 

The bar opens around 11-30am, and has a wide-range of craft beers brewed on-premises. There are two separate parts to LeVeL33. There is a restaurant, which caters to well-dressed office people; and a bar on the balcony, which sees casual groups of flip-flop wearing individuals in shorts, sunnies, t-shirts. I'm reviewing from the latter point-of-view.

The balcony is just a great outdoor experience with a ~240 degree-view of Singapore. You can see visually from Fullerton Hotel -to- The Esplanade -to- the Marina Bay waterway -to- The Float -to- The Art Science Museum -to- MBS -to- Gardens by the Bay -to- Ships in Singapore Strait -to- the other towers of Marina Boulevard (and slightly beyond).

The beers are interesting and tasty. I tried the IPA (quite strong and heady) and the Lager (much easier drinking) and enjoyed both. Given the location, the drinks were expensive, but this was to be expected, and I cannot fault them on pricing.

However, where there is a disconnect to the bar is the lack-of-food options. There is a food menu that accompanies the drink menu, but whilst the bar opens at 11-30am, the bar food is not available until 2-30pm (I think this is because they do not want a clash with their restaurant). This 3-hour window of difference between drink-and-food ensures that if you are interested in a session you'll have to basically go elsewhere because you'll be drunk well before 2-30pm arrives.

This is exactly what our crew did (there was 8 of us). We were 3-4 drinks in, and needed food to accompany any further alcohol, and since there was a significant wait ahead of us, we decided to leave and go elsewhere despite this location being fantastic.

Service *appears* to be patchy. Before arriving, one of our team was reporting that service was very slow, whilst upon my arrival I had no trouble gaining the attention of servers whenever my beer was running low. So this might be something to think about when it gets busy (it wasn't very busy when we were there).

I feel like this bar is a must-visit, even if you just come up for 1-2 drinks and enjoy the view (take a video or a pano) then head back down. For tourists it's literally 30 minutes of your day to capture an incredible view of the city and won't cost you an arm-and-a-leg like MBS does. 

NB: LeVeL33 has its own lift in Tower 1 of Marina Boulevard, and is located to the very left-hand side past the Standard Chartered signage. You cannot miss the LeVeL33 signage, once you see that, the lift is located in the alcove next to it.

text:
Hipster cafe, great for Instagram-ready fusion--style brunches, as well as cosy date nights. I went there on a Saturday night after 8pm and there was plenty of seats. You order at the main counter, serve yourself water and cutlery, and they bring your food to you. 

We had the mentaiko salmon pasta, the salmon pho and the salted egg mochi w ice cream. For the price, portions of the mains aren't particularly large, but maybe the restaurant's strategy is to leave room for dessert! 

The mentaiko salmon pasta was done perfectly. Al dente pasta, al dente salmon and creamy mentaiko. Mmm mmm mmm! The salmon pho, is a completely different dish. The broth and noodles are delicate, but the salmon was a tad overdone. Otherwise, it's a really nice dish. The salted egg mochi was ah-mazing! I dont know if any other restaurants do it, but it's definitley a heart stopper. They also give 3 mochis, so be prepared to fight if sharing between an even number of people!

text:
I ordered their Parma Ham Benedict to try which cost me $16.90
My colleague ordered their vegetarian pasta. 
My parma ham benedict is tasty. Filing too. Ambience is nice too. There is a big t.v. on the wall, a lot of flowers and furniture. Realised that they are under Xpressflower too as their staffs are wearing Xpressflower logo. Definitely will come back again for more.
Fancy tea place in Singapore.  Bit overpriced but a huge selection of teas. Great ambience.. well deserved 3.5 stars.

text:
The Skinny: Opens at 10am, has very limited food menu (basically savoury/dessert waffles and other cakes/sweets). They don't really do breakfast. The coffee is not barista-level.

The Review: This place is literally a 2 minute walk from my front door, so is extremely convenient and although this is my first visit I will no doubt be back many times. Whilst they do have a wide selection of coffee, it is not a great brew. I had the Expresso Macchiato (apparently that variation of the word is correct), and a Long Black (times 2). The first was good, the second was OK. I'm used to high quality coffee so I found these just OK, but the pricing is good.

The ambience of the place is very chill; they have a laid-back playlist on in the background which is not too loud and not too soft. During my visit from 10-1, the place had about 7 people in it, which is about 1/4 full.

The lounges give you the opportunity to have a relaxing coffee - they also have wifi and power outlets and make an ideal working space for those interested in a chilled workspace.

Overall - not a bad place to stop, catch your bearings, or do a spot of work.

Upon leaving I walked past the coffee shop next door which was much busier and tempting.

text:
The cafe was newly opened and it was having a 50% off promotion for its 5 dessert items. Open concept place where people walking past can look into the dine in area and kitchen. The place was decorated in wooden and simple style.

As it was newly opened, the staff who showed me to a table advised that it would take at least 20 minutes for a order to arrive. It was quite a surprise as it was already 9pm and the cafe was less than half filled with a number of uncleared tables around. 

Cloud Nine 九霄云外 (S$14.90++)
miso soufflé, yuzu ice cream & vanilla tuile
味增舒芙蕾松饼、柚子冰淇淋、香草瓦片饼
There was a 20 minutes wait for this item which I was told by the staff when I placed the order. There was no sauce served with souffle, although it was showed with on the menu. The souffle was pretty airy and soft, but one could not taste the miso in it. Being sweet, it was balanced by the slightly sour yuzu sorbet. It was accompanied with the lavender flowers dusted tuile.

White Ginger Pear 梨白牡丹茶 (S$5.50++)
rarest pai mu tan white tea blended with the sweet taste of juicy orchard fresh pear & the tingle of spicy ginger for a delicate & delighting infusion
Not sure why but the taste reminded one of ginseng than ginger or pear. It was light and refreshing.

text:
Finally tried this. I ordered less less sweet but they said they only had less sweet and it's a premix. They allowed me to try and then when i found it too sweet still, they said to drink some and they would top it up.

Good flavour and a nice big cup but it also cost $3.90 so it was a bit expensive. They ran out of the more expensive bottles. Not tastier than Cha Tra Mue.

text:
Ordered the pancake Apple crumble. It is sweet and tasty. Cost $12. Filled with Apple crumble. I really like it a lot. The texture of the pancake is soft too. Yummy ! My friend ordered housemade English breakfast. Cost $16.50
It looks yummy and smells good too. She ordered the Cold Brew and I ordered the Chamomile tea. Total bill cost $44.95 with gst. This cafe have a outdoor seating on the 3rd floor. 2nd floor have a two seat designed as a swing facing the window. But the spaces are limited. The ambience is nice. Thumbs up!

text:
A quiet cafe amongst the many cafes at South Beach. Power points and free wi-fi is available.

While pleasantly quiet and spacious, caffe vergnano fails to stand out from the various other options at South Beach. The beverages include standard machine coffee that lack the sincerity of the handmade cuppas in nearby cafes and the cakes failed to impress. I had the earl grey lavender cake ($8.50++) which had too much cream for my liking and only a hint of earl grey notes. My partner had the peanut butter cheesecake which was average.

That being said, one may still consider dropping by to get done work done or have some time alone to get away from the bustling city life on a busy afternoon.

This is one of my fave places to grab a coffee when at raffles city. The coffee is good and there's the usual types as well as unusual coffee types for the adventurous. We tried two of the chill box cakes. Ondeh ondeh as well as chocolate mousse. The former was the last piece and I was worried it would be dry. Glad that it was not and it was really yummy. The pandan chiffon had good flavor and was soft and bouncy. The Gula melaka coconut filling was sweet and the small layer of cream helped to balance that. The chocolate cake had a thick crunchy layer at the bottom, adding a nice crunchy texture. Nothing really outstanding or unique but both well executed. Nice pairing with tea or coffee!

text: One of my favorite hawker centers in Singapore. They have a huge selection of food styles and cuisines available and you will surely find something that suits your palate. I've been here multiple times for different meals and have never been disappointed.

text:
Chinatown complex market and food centre. 
#02-167. Don & Udon
$5.50 for Gyu Niku Don. 
Just a nice name, slightly overpriced and less quantity (they serve kids meals size) as main meals. Taste so so. Do not recommend as other Gyu Don elsewhere taste better and slightly more quantity to serve as lunch or dinner.

So I wanted this Westin Lobby Lounge to be better than it was.  The brand Westin alone insinuates a certain expectation.  I am hopeful that on my next visit it will be better.  Although I am only giving them 3 stars at this point, there is room for improvement and I will gamble my next visit will be improved. 

Being a hotel lobby lounge expert on a global scale, the ambiance of the Westin Lobby Lounge has all the right things going for it.  Stunning view, some exclusivity perched up on the 36 floor, cool music, intimate settings yet a group appeal, comfy laid back well appointed environment.  

The let down was on the drink itself.  Grey Goose, served up, a couple olives.  A classic martini.  The staffs first attempt took about 15 minutes and arrived with a salted rim.  What?  Not certain what was going on and how a bartender in any major city could miss the mark on a simple classic martini.  I sent it back and about 10 minutes later, a proper martini arrived.  It could have better olives, but the martini itself was OK.  So after 30 minutes in and shaking off the confusion of a being first given a salted rim martini, I am finally enjoying my experience in the Westin Lobby Lounge.  

So I will be back to this lounge and maybe might order a glass of wine or a bottle of bear to tee things up for a successful visit, because this place has all the ingredients for an exceptional experience. 

On a side note, know the lounge also serves some food as well.  Lighter, appetizer type items.

text: This place is only hip because of its location. It's kind of cramped, and the food is no better than Sushi Tei. Not too pricey, but that's not enough a reason to go back.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ling C.', 'displayLocation': '天后, Hong Kong', 'altText': 'Ling C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 52, 'reviewCount': 71, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Clean, cheap and cheerful - just follow the queues of people and I don't think you can ever go wrong. My parents were impressed at the quality of the food, the selection and the overall cleanliness of the centre. We didn't get a chance to visit the Tiong Baru one but compared to Hong Lim and Lau Pa Sat - this is the one we will happily return for some local fare. Just follow the queues of people and order whatever they do - you won't be disappointed

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ling C.', 'displayLocation': '天后, Hong Kong', 'altText': 'Ling C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 52, 'reviewCount': 71, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Uber local, a bit grimy and pay for use toilets- Hong Lim came highly rated - however, found that the food at Maxwell seemed to be of higher quality and the hawker centre cleaner. We had the famous pork noodle and fried kway teo which wasn't really anything to write home about. We enjoyed the curry puff and the rice dumplings (nyonya rice dumpling was really different and yummy). But next time I will just give this one a miss and try the Chinatown one or go back to Maxwell to get my fill of local food.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ling C.', 'displayLocation': '天后, Hong Kong', 'altText': 'Ling C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 52, 'reviewCount': 71, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Came here 5 years ago and was unimpressed, and upon my return also found it underwhelming. We came just before the lunch crowd and found that the selection and quality was a far cry from the other hawker centres that we went to. And it also seemed to lack some authenticity to the dishes - felt like it was a tourist haunt, tourist prices and dishes catered to the tourist palate. If you're looking for satays, they aren't served at lunch time. I'm surprised by all the high ratings for this place, I think you would fare better at a food court than here. Maybe it's the post drinking measuring stick?

text:
An everyday pitstop on weekdays as it's downstairs from the office and much better than the nearby alternatives.

The staff are super friendly and upbeat and give your morning a good kickstart. They'll also remember your order and have it ready-to-go if you become very regular.

They have light bites but I almost never partake of these preferring to just get my coffee and run; but when I do stick around to do some outdoor work they have a nice little section outside to people-watch or get some laptop work done; they also have wi-fi if you need it.

The loyalty kicks in at coffee #12, which is a bit different to most places which do it on #10.

After dark they have beer & wine options, though I have never done them here.

text:
Get away from the hustle 'n' bustle!

This funky little craft brew joint caters to all types and offers chillaxing vibes after a hard day at the salt mines.

Stone & Wood's Pacific Ale offers a crisp clean and easy drinker starter to get the night going; A red apple cider from Zeffer and Sunday's sweet malt pilsner liven up the party before the hammer comes down with Stone's IPA (6.4%).

Another one would seemingly be a good idea before you realise you have a marketing pitch the next day.

Time to put these plans (and yourself) to bed!

text: Interesting twist on some traditional dishes. But the menu is too short, the atmosphere too casual (tables set in a corridor of a mall!), and the dishes not good enough for people to go back on return visits. Of the dishes we tried at lunch, only the salmon Yu sheng bowl was good. The rendang carrot cake and the wagyu beef bowl were interesting, but too rich that one must struggle to finish the small serving. Only young people might go hete more than once, and prices nay be too high for many of them.

text:
when coffee meets bagels........
coffee we have plenty in sg!
bagels? well they are indeed rare and hard to find!

good coffee? yes
good bagels? probably the best in sg!
and for coffee to meet bagels here in novena? automatic 5 stars!;)

when they first popped up in tanjong pagar, many yelpers were lavishing mouthwatering praise.
our previous cm michelle even got them to tie up with the new black for a yelp event and all who attended were sold on how good they are and craved for more!
that culminated in us holding a subsequent UYE brunch at their tp location not so long after.

cold retarded, no, not you, the dough.
handrolled.
boiled in honey water.
flavoured and then tanned in the oven on site for a freshness that can't escape the bite.

need something extra?
toasted and schmeared for extra taste and texture.
still looking for that something extra?
the legends and the breakfast club configurations will take that to the next level!
be it savoury or sweet, meaty or plant loving, there is something fishy too!
nicely stacked, halved and wrapped.
maximum enjoyment, minimum messiness.

a favourite with the expats and millenials.
non airconditioned but who needs it with the recent cold spells in sg?
the staff will definitely warm you up with their cool attitude and infectious friendliness.

my only wish is for the onion and garlic flavours to make it's way here from enggor st and the coffee meets bagel experience will be complete......

The Coffee, Alchemist', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The Coffee, Alchemist'}]
text:
Double, double toil and trouble,
Fire burn and cauldron bubble.
Cool it with a fine soy milk,
Then it tastes as smooth as silk.

There is definitely some alchemical coffee ministrations going on at this small stark black and white hole in the wall inside International Plaza.

From the shiny metallurgical instruments to the precision of measuring beans, this truly is the best coffee in Tanjong Pagar, and despite others being more convenient, if you really want something that knocks your socks off, this is the place.

The Dark Matter is the bean of choice: Its nutty bitterness provides a robust roast for those in need of a strong kickstart in the AM. 

Can recommend highly - sometimes simplicity really is the best!

We had the umi rice, salmon baked rice and wagyu rice.  Dishes came out fine tasted ok and looked ok.  Nothing special but perhaps priced a little high?  Just based on the cost of latte at 7.8 and that is before gst and service charge.  Think be better off to get at starbucks.  

Jan 28th '17
Pinoy waitress not that great but Kuian i think was her namr was excellent. Back again just because i love the fluffy pancakes.

text: This is their Rosti Benedict ($17). Looks good and taste wise is not bad. Friends ordered their Assembly Brunch ($20), Rendang Mac and Cheese ($18) and Rotisserie Chicken ($18). The Rendang Mac and Cheese smells really nice ! The assembly brunch have really a large portion. The Rotisserie Chicken taste good. The chicken is very tender. Once in a while, spending this much.

text:
Great variety of fusion food

Beef rice - 5/5 quality of meat is great and sauce tastes good

Soy sweet potato fries- 4/5: sauce a little too sweet for me

Chicken rice risotto 4/5 - The combination is divine... but sadly, I personally can't take a lot of diary/creamy food, so I wouldn't order an entire dish for myself.

Lemongrass chamomile 1/5 - very sweet.. reminds me of Apple tea, I was expecting something a little lighter and less sweet from the name

I am a Coffee Bean fan.  I am....life long committed member to the Coffee Bean fan club (memberships is free and they do not issue club cards, just in case you were curious).   It is the quality of the bean that personally hooked me probably 15 years ago.  It is not as brutal a taste as Starbucks, not weak like Dunkin Donuts coffee or other similar US brands, but in line with taste as Pacific Coffee a bit.  In the end, it is all about the basic bean. 

This Coffee Bean location has a large seating area and there was even a large committee meeting going on while my husband and I dropped by this past Saturday morning.  They also have food options like pasta and salad on their menu, if you needed to get in a little meal with your coffee. This was in addition to the standard bagels and breakfast type sandwiches in the cold case on display. 

Seating is generous and comfortable, free WIFI and room to work, friendly staff and the consistent Coffee Bean branded quality coffee bean....I am hooked and will be back.

Sitting next to the post office on Nassim Hill is not the best spot for a restaurant, parking not great luckily I can walk from my office for lunch.  They have a decent selection of sandwiches and lunch fares service is ok.  Some of the options are tastier/more flavorful than others. Not my favorite place but good for change up from typical Tanglin food.

text:
Loads of food options, the german rosti with salmon is recommended, comes with a sunny side up for $12.50! You can get also get their lunch specials so for $12.50, you get your rosti with a free drink! Milkshakes are included in the lunch deal!

the wifi is fast and I spent some time there doing my work during off-peak hours. Their mocha is nice and chocolately. I've had it about 4 times  now :) The staff are friendly and accomodating.

Their pastas are about $10nett and reasonably portioned. I feel that the food prices here are geared towards the students in the neighbouring area, so it's very wallet friendly!

text:
The kopi is surprisingly good. I like it a lot. Robust and sweet with a generous lashing of evaporated milk. The kaya butter toast was equally good and could give Ya Lum a run for its money in the crispy toast department. 

The laksa was not that great. I liked the ingredients but the gravy lacked flavor and punch. Eat Laksa is much better in comparison. 

At 4pm on a weekday, it was about 50% full. It made a nice respite from shopping or the heat.
