text:
Situated at the front of the old badminton complex, the cafe is easily located just 6 minutes away from Mountbatten MRT. 

Despite a decent seating capacity, the cafe was rather crowded when we visited on a weekday afternoon. Though spacious, the small square shaped metal chairs are not ideal for a long afternoon of chilling. 

What made the visit worth it was the coffee. I ordered the flat white ($5) and the cold brew ($7.80) as well as the raspberry coconut cake ($7.70) and the coffee walnut cake ($7.30). While the cold brew and cakes were average, what stood out for me was the flat white. Creamy with distinct fruity notes, it was the perfect combination one would demand from a cuppa. 

While not the best place for intense mugging, Brawn and brains is undoubtedly second to few when it comes to brewing the perfect cuppa and would make a great place for catching up with friends or that casual afternoon tea.

text:
Lots of hawkerpreneur (new generation hawker) here. Weekday lunch time super crowded but this place most stall only opens on weekday breakfast and lunch time. 

Recommend this level 2-157 stall named Gyu Nami
Wagyu beef  Donburi for $10 only. The bowl is a bill small and hence lesser quantity. However , food is of good quality and quite tasty. The beef is thin and tender, about 60% cook, just nice. Recommend to try it. 

*Tips: Use Favepay to get 10% rebate for next use. So one person pay with the same favepay account 1 by 1, this way the 2nd person that is the 2nd bowl only pay $9. This way you'll save $1 for the 2nd person / bowl straight away rather than have to wait for next time coming back to be able to use the $1 rebate. Because you might not come back again before it's 3 months expiry. Enjoy 

Cheers

I really needed a place to get away and do some work and the crew here made me a great coffee and then let me sit there for hours, right up until closing time, with smiles and great service.  Great spot to work if you're in the area.

text:
this one ape show is just what the doctor ordered!

come get wired by haslee, the alpha ape!
super friendly, knowledgable and serves up an excellent shot or two of caffeine that he personally blends and roasts at tiong hoe's premises, with a perfectly balanced infusion of moo moo, if that's how you take your coffee.

nice ambience with free wifi, charging points, edgy arty walls and the right amount of a/c to keep you as cool as this place is.

parking can be a challenge but mayo street, perak road and dickson road are good scouting routes for street parking lots before heading down dunlop street as a last resort.

else take the downtown line to either rochor or jalan besar station and it's a short walk from either.

it's definitely well off the beaten caffeine track but also well worth your effort should you so choose to accept this mission.

this review will self destruct in.................

This is the Bukit Timah branch. Located next to Coronation Plaza sling a row of multi storey terrace shophouses, there're plenty of parking kerb side along the front or behind within the housing estate. 

I had the steak and fries, meat was tender and nicely done to a pink medium. Would have preferred fries to be string cut and crispy instead. There's a good selection of sandwiches and salads plus the usual cafe fare like fish and chips. Love that they serve fresh tea leaves for my pot of ginger mint tea.

4 Twinkle Stars indeed.   Was there early about 11:30am Wednesday so not that many people which is a goos thing.   Overall for food i got to say they do pay enough attention to its execution i.e Pasta - Al Dente ,  Fries Crispy , Coffee with Art . For 24 plus plus frankly is lot of food amd we struggle to stay away after the lunch as my usual lunch is a salad.   oh yes one more very important thing - the lunch set comes with ice cream even if u top up for a cuppacino just to be clear.   I did hiwever need to asl for it as the staff seem to have forgotten - i think :).

Food was good - service was super slow. We came for lunch and there was only 2 staffs. 1 we multi-tasking as the cook. Not a place I would recommend if you only have 1 hour for lunch. Otherwise, worth the try!

text: Singapore is the perfect place to have local Chinese style breakfast. They called it 'kopi tiam' or place to have coffee. The simple simple breakfast usually a cup of coffee or tea with 'kaya' jam sandwich and half boiled eggs in a bowl. Of course, this place also have 'nasi lemak' and cakes. Very popular with locals.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/r__a74nhs6oLs0l-eq2bLg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ultra-bake-singapore-4?reviewid=LZj7WVs8M7Xgx0KytTfdfA&select=r__a74nhs6oLs0l-eq2bLg', 'altText': 'Photo of Ultra Bake - Singapore, Singapore. A tiny sliver of a store front', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'A tiny sliver of a store front'}]
text:
Do not be intimidated by the daily morning line that might be 30 people deep in the AM, Ulta Bake gets their customers loaded up with fresh baked pastries and cheap coffee at precision conveyor belt speed and gets their customers served quickly. 

This is solely a grab and go spot.  This location is really like a sliver of a location with only a tiny store front.  But the staff is always friendly, the baked items are always well stocked & made fresh daily (off sight I suspect) and the coffee is good.  Everything is super cheap too!  Nothing fancy going on here, just easy, simple, cheap, good baked bread like items. (No cookies or sweets like that, but bread items)

So a quick AM snack before you head to your work desk in the CBD or just something to nibble on before you head to a park bench near the marina to catch some fresh air, Ulta Bake is simple, easy and OK by me.

A hell of a good cup of coffee!  Great Ethiopian blend, blueberry aromas and blended into a cafe  au last...really kind of caught me off guard it was so full bodied and nice.  

Currently the only "coffee specific" coffee shop in the Marina One the Heart mall in the CBD, what a charming little spot for a cup of joe.  Also to find out that the first Jewel coffee shop opened up in the CBD One Shenton Way in only 2011, Jewel is like the fastest growing coffee house chain in Singapore with several outlets around the island. 

They have seating, the decor is "red subway tile meets stainless steel & wood" is cute yet edgy, the staff is friendly and your cup is brewed fresh.  The bean was good, the single origin flavor and its delicious roasted aroma is better than the average house blend you will find out there.  I am a hard core coffee drinker and I was impressed.  They rotate their bean varietals daily. 

And from a marketing perspective, their loyalty card is a home run (I don't know why all coffee spots don't have them...It makes a customer like me loyal! DUH!).  It tosses a dog a bone and I always like to see this touch at establishments.  Buy 8 coffee drinks, get one free! 

I enjoy giving my money to anyone but the Starbucks monster machine, so I think I might be in love with the new gem of Jewel Coffee in my hood.

I've been here several times and yes... PS Cafe can be pretty overpriced... and yes... Not everything is AMAZING. But I love the vibe of the original restaurant at Dempsey and I can't ever complain about my favorite sticky date pudding so I will always keep coming back.

Whenever I visit PS Cafe, I'll always order the sticky date pudding or the ginger pudding. Both are delicious and I always make room for them. Not a fan of anything a la mode though, so I usually request for the ice-cream on the side, or not at all. Their cakes go great with tea (or coffee, if you are on that side of the camp) and their selection is fair but nothing to gush over.

My favorite thing about PS Cafe at Harding Road is its amazing location and how it feels like a greenhouse that's cool (thank you air-conditioning) and yet is surrounded by greenery everywhere. And the best part is how a lot of the greenery was kept as it was and isn't some pruned garden that they created around the restaurant. It makes for a lovely afternoon visit so you can enjoy being surrounded by nature.

Maybe I'm a little biased, but I really love Pantler. They have very decent pastries at prices that range from reasonable to exorbitant, and the waitstaff are always friendly. It's a nice spot right in the middle of the CBD yet sitting in there on a weekday afternoon, you'd never feel like you're in the middle of the city.

My favorite pastries here are the roll cake, cream puffs, strawberry shortcake and the chocolate cake (possibly called the Yatsura... My brain forgets). Some of their more experimental cakes can fall flat when they try to combine different flavors and textures, others are very decent, and still others sing. I think they do the classics quite well and you'll need to be a little brave to venture beyond them. Sometimes you're rewarded, and other times, you're glad you tried those flavors anyway.

You can ask for ice-packs if you get the cakes to go which is really nice in the horrendous tropical heat. And you can either dine in-store with a nice cup of coffee or tea, or get take-out and stuff your face at home. No one's judging.

I used to come here all the time when I worked in the area for their Iced Honey Lime Tea. It's a super refreshing drink, and a great take on the usual lemon tea to mix things up a bit. The service here is efficient and there are 2 lines - one for placing an order, one for collecting your drink which gets people through their coffee lines quick. I wouldn't say this is the best tea you're ever going to have, but it's really affordable for the area and its longggg lines at breakfast and post-lunch attest to its popularity.

Would definitely recommend if you're in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

text:
Alway a lime at this outlet at lunch time.

Good quality sandwiches and croissants.

Almond croissant was a little heavy. Some sweet thing stuffed inside that makes it a bit jelat.

Coffee is strong.

Friendly service. Systematic way of dealing with the crowd.

From the notice board, I found that they have another 100% gluten free cafe called The Butcher's Wife which is about 5 minutes from this cafe.

text: My first barista experience here in SG, the pour over is pretty good as well as their cake. Specially recommend the rose tea cake. The price here is decent while the ambiance is quiet and cozy

text: A nice cafe with plenty of sunshine coming in thru the windows! I tried their lunch set menu, which comes with a pita and ice tea, the price is decent however portion is quite small. Definitely recommended if u just want to find a place for a good chat and some sweet dessert!

text:
Old Town White Coffee...

I went here coz you are a Halal Certified establishment.  That ALONE is an added bonus in my books.

My 2nd trip here.  Last year was with my Cousin In Law and our good friend for Late Breakfast and Early Lunch on a PUBLIC Holiday aka National Day.

This time around it was on Tuesday for Lunch.  Time was about 12:15hrs ish.  Thankfully I managed to get seats.  This time around it was outside aka "patio" aka along the walk way of the Mall etc.

My mother opt for the Fish Ball Noodle Soup and we shared the Fried Wantons Dumplings.  I like the Fried Wantons Dumplings coz its FRIED to order and comes out HOT!  As for beverages I opt for the Ice Chendol.  Our Lunch or I would say, my Dining experience here is doable.  None of the items I had stood out.  Disappointing dish or I would say the Beverage aka Ice Chendol I had.  Too diluted and the chendol DO NOT taste authentic chedol at all for my personal taste bud.  Perhaps they get their chendol factory made.

Especially during Public Holiday, do plan to arrive early if you want to dine in.  This establishment tends to be packed to the brim.  This is also my observation during LUNCH hour on a Weekday.  *SIGH*

You pay your order inside at the counter.  The staffs are so-so.  NOT the friendly or accommodating type.  *DOUBLE SIGH*

May return BUT NOT in a hurry.  Hence this GENEROUS 3 stars review.  Actually its ALMOST 2.5 stars at best!

text:
Chocolate. 
That's it. That's all you need to know. I'm not even a huge chocolate person, but this place must pump the aroma out to the street because I can't walk by without having to come in and get a muffin. I'm not even a big muffin person either! But, oh! Sweet manna from heaven. These are filled with decadent fillings and fresh from the oven.

text: Mellower coffee is a morning surprise for me, while walking toward Bugis, I happened to run into this cozy coffee shop. Order a cup of their signature drink- Sweet Little Rain, I'm amazed by how creative a cup of typical American coffee can be. The cotton candy on top of the coffee adds in just the right amount of sweetness to the black coffee, pretty much creates a good balance between bitter and sweet. Overall I'm satisfied with my experiences here at Mellower.

text: One must be a huge fan of the Plain Vanilla brand to come to this café. It is hidden in the back of a local apparel shop. What's on offer is eclectic: cupcakes and tarts (their main products), a few sandwiches, 3 salads, coffee and tea. The food looks fresh. I had two salads. The supersalad is good; the chicken and saffron rice salad is too dry. Unless you want to have a quiet bite, you'd be better off at a real coffee shop or salad bar.

text: I would say that I accidentally discovered this place, but having walked past it a few times in a number of days, I decided that it might be an idea to step in and check it out. Anyway, I hadn't had much in the way of breakfast yet and I was starting to feel hungry. Well, if you happen to be in that position, then this place is certainly a place worth checking out. The staff were excellent, and the food wasn't all that pricey either. They made a decent pot of tea, and there was a reasonable range on the menu as well, It is certainly a decent place to check out.

text:
I was staying at Marina Bay Sands and decided to do tea time before dinner!

In America we don't have TWG so I was excited to try it out!

As soon as you walk in you'll feel like you got transported to a Parisian cafe! The ambience, decorations even music was on point!
I loved how they were playing Andrea Bocelli the entire time!

We ordered macaroons and champagne! The macaroons were sensational!

Also! 

Big thank you to the staff for never letting my glass get empty! 

Can't wait to come back!!

Double shot coffee at a much lower price than Starbucks and with a wonderful latte art!!??  I say kudos to the owner as passion for good coffee shows.  Service was also efficient and food wonderful.  Only thing is you got to be patient for the wait as good things come to those who waits :).

text:
Located in Novena this hawker food center is one of the smaller ones by definitely more airy and less traffic!

I got a bowl of prawn mee and a plate of cockle kway teo for around $4 USD!

Also! On the other side of the food stalls there is a local market that have a lot of fresh produce as well!

text:
This is heaven!

I'm obsessed win Sanrio and made plans to come here months before our trip!

The decor is superb with everything Gudetama theme! It seriously was so so fun!

In terms of food.. it was OKAY. It was pretty overpriced and not that good. But reading from past reviews I already expected it so we just shared a dish for pictures lol!

If you're a Gudetama fan you have to stop by!

Service was wonderful !

Thank you guys!

Grungy hole in the Wall Cafe (bright red rain awning at front door is how you know it's this cafe). Coffee offerings include oat or soy milk. I had former but it wasn't that great (quite sour) -- should use Oatly! Avocado toastie was amazingly yummy but way overpriced for three slices for $10 including a bunch of undressed salad leaves (!!)

Weekday morning and sufficiently empty and calm to find tables. Tad dark at some spots making reading difficult.

text:
After getting completely lost looking for this place, we were surprised to find a super cute cafe in the middle of (almost) nowhere. It's discreetly hidden amongst a row of shophouses so it's really cute.

The service was a bit choppy - some servers were great and others were confused. I think if everyone had been a little more on top of things, I'd be a much happier customer!

We got 3 things to share:
1. Cauliflower fritters - decent with a nice dipping sauce but was a little too over fried, I think the cauliflower would have done equally well roasted and would have been even better and healthier
2. Black rice with steak - really loved the texture of the rice which was bouncy and chewy and delicious with the Japanese mayo and tobiko! The steak was surprisingly juicy and not overcooked.
3. Buccatini with thick cut bacon - this was disappointing, the sauce had no flavor (squid ink) and the bacon was really salty. The bacon however, did balance out the pasta which had no flavor. We agreed that this would have done better with udon rather than using a pasta.

We had tea and coffee as well, all of which were fine but nothing stood out. I would go back if I lived/worked in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip.

text: I don't know whether it's Taiwanese food in general or this place in particular - probably more of the latter - but the food, while ok, is kind of boring and variety is less than at Teochew or certainly Cantonese eateries here. For a café, prices are on the high side (and they don't serve water, cold or warm, only bottled water). Without the Entertainer 1-for-1 offer, it doesn't make much sense to eat here!

We came here one evening after dinner and were amazed at how many people were getting ice cream on a Friday night. I would have thought bars would be a much more popular destination. Nevertheless, we managed to snag a table just as a group was leaving so, lucky us!

We ordered a waffle with 3 scoops of ice cream to share. While I did not love the waffle, my friends did - I like my waffles crisp and light all the way through. This was a little dense and slightly undercooked in the middle which made it feel chewier and more substantial.

What I really enjoyed were the ice-creams! We got Pistachio, The Apiary, and dark chocolate. They were a little on the sweet side, but what is dessert without sugar anyway? My favorite was definitely the Apiary - it had a milk base with honey and vanilla, and also honeycomb. Yum on all counts!! The pistachio was fragrant but a little too sweet for me. The dark chocolate was heaven but I'm not a huge chocolate person.

I would go back to try their black and white sesame ice creams. Yum yum.

text: Ikea-type décor; the couch on which you sit is a storage box. The crabmeat linguine is horrible, with mushy pasta. Unlike better eateries, they can only cook burgers medium or well-done; anyway, the buns fall apart too easily. Even with 1-for-1 Entertainer offer, it is poor value. Even if you stay at the Ascott, you should avoid; there are better and better-value joints nearby.

text:
The marketing game here is on point. Beautiful inviting storefront with bright colors. That's pretty much how they got me to stop inside. I was walking and on my way to the Chinatown MRT and I stumbled upon this cute coffee shop. 

All the desserts and drinks are creatively titled like the Clouds in my Coffee, a super creamy cold brew that is mildly sweet. Delicious! I even ordered a side of macarons as a sweet snack just to balance the coffee, but honestly, it wasn't necessary. The cold brew has a nice aftertaste without being overly bitter. 

The staff was super nice and friendly as well! Definitely a great find here in the Chinatown area of Singapore.

text:
You're paying for the experience. From the elegant food to the bougey ambiance of the Marina Bay Shoppes, that is pretty much what you are paying for when you dine here. 

I've always walked by this location every time I've been to Singapore and I was always curious to what it was like. I landed in Singapore in the late afternoon and wanted a quick snack time with some caffeine involved.

I ordered the Fortune Tea Set during their high tea hours. I thought the food was very delicious. Just what you would want for an afternoon pick up. My tea tower included one of the finger sandwiches, scones or muffins, and three macarons. I decided on the truffle croque, the golden raisen scones, a earl grey tea macaron, a rose macaron, and a tiramisu macaron. For the tea, I decide on the hot original Black Tea 1837. 

I would be back again for afternoon high tea. Not sure if I want to eat here for a full meal because there are a ton of other heartier and more "value" options around the Marina Bay Shoppes. I say give this place a try if your looking for high tea and live your glamorous life! You're in Singapore in the first place!

text: It should be either Le Bijou or Les Bijoux, but not Le Bijoux. The French may be half-baked, but the bread and cakes are freshly baked, and what's not sold at the end of the day is given to charities. Sandwiches are good, service is warm and friendly, and prices are very reasonable. But in these days of intense consumerist competition, you must be a real nostalgic to come to this non-aircon place with furniture that is more charming than aesthetic or comfortable. For the food is good, but not sufficiently unique. The owner's talent and dedication may be better served elsewhere, with bolder ambitions.

text:
Although I have only been here once with my husband for a late Sunday brunch, I will be back.  

The place is large and has seating indoors and outside.  You can make a reservation if need be (which I really like!).  The menu is interesting and made with as many locally grown foods as possible.  There is a bar top counter where a solo person could drink coffee, linger and read a book (this is me!).  

But the coffee...the aroma of those beans is such a beautiful thing from the moment you walk through the front door.  It is intoxicating in a way that only a coffee lover would truly appreciate.  The cup I had was really delicious and I look forward to going back and enjoying more real soon.

text:
Yummy Japanese bakery with very creative pastries. Quality is not that good but the concept is there.

The Royal Milk Tea Loaf is soft and fluffy. The croissants and cinnamon buns are not soft, even when heated so kind of disappointing.

The lattes are good.

Lots of seats but it does get busy during the weekend.
Overall an "OK" experience. We had several brunch / lunch items: salmon, toast, etc. and everything was standard - not particularly good or bad. Space is a bit cramped.

text:
I like coming here at sunset on a weekend because it's quiet and there's a great view without having to fight off the crowds that you'd get at One Altitude or on the MBS rooftop. The fact that there's a microbrewery on the 33rd floor of a building is pretty cool and I think some of their beers are quite nice despite not being a beer drinker at all.

The beers and drinks are on the pricey side, as are the food options. However, since it's a bar with a view, it's not bad. And at least they taste pretty decent. Service is pretty non-existent but it's nice to be left alone. If you go early, you won't need a reservation but might get kicked out by 6 or 7pm.

text:
Got to give it to them coffee was indeed above average.  However if i compared it to Tolido.....hmmm......

Now the kicker would be the food.  We were the first in the Cafe as it open. But boy....did it take long to get it on our table.  Taste wise it was alright.  Nothing to be wowed.  We had the Turkish egg and French Toast.  

Think they should spend a little time to clean up the Cafe.  Seeing spider web at the corner where the speakers are just don't give you the cozy feeling.  

So some reason the waitress were very conscious about their looks?  Flipping their hairs more often then focusing on their jobs?

text: Whoa their straight nitro cold brew is awesome. Super strong. They got a small branch at Bukit Timah plaza tucked away from the huge crowd. Nice and quiet little corner though there's not much seats. Drop by when u have a chance. Love their coffee :) will definitely be back again.

Once Sogurt's flagship outlet, now remodelled and rebranded to Kara. Sogurt's co-founder was a student at USC (#fighton!) and was inspired by Yogurtland to bring the self-serve froyo concept back to Singapore. Kara cafe offers both savoury dishes and sweet desserts (including Sogurt froyo AND new ice cream!)

Ambience is great, decor is cute. There's a nice balance of the cuteness of what Sogurt used to be, and its more sophisticated counterpart, KARA. There's nothing not to like about the space!

Their menu features an interesting mix of cuisines (mix of Mexican, Korean, Japanese, etc). That, coupled with the decor and the craft beers, kinda gave me an LA vibe. I've had the chance to try some of their entrees, including the grain bowls and the fish and chips. The food is decently good for a brunch date / with family.

I love that they still kept their self-serve froyo concept at the back of the store even after changing the style of the outlet. Ask for sample cups if you want to try any of the new flavours! They also have an interesting mochi waffle that you can order together with your froyo/ice cream!

If you ever need to rent a space, they also have a second floor that is able to host a good number of people for an event. 

Parking right outside the store is limited (perhaps less than 10 lots). Would recommend either parking at Coronation Plaza nearby, or at the parking spaces near the private housings further in. 
Alternatively, it's less than a 5 min walk from Tan Kah Kee MRT station (DTL)!

I had a massive craving one day for financiers and was really pleased to find a place that made them fresh. While they are pricey ($3.50 each), I still got two to try - the matcha and regular one.

They were still hot from the oven when I got them, and wow! Nothing beats soft insides, crisp exterior, and a rich decadent buttery taste altogether. So simple, so good.

Come and get a few for yourself, and eat it right away!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mcVjnx4F18lgZTWHE1CRVw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/knots-cafe-and-living-singapore?reviewid=PxkpbOmE-Jq3ipZITrudgA&select=mcVjnx4F18lgZTWHE1CRVw', 'altText': 'Photo of Knots Cafe & Living - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gk3mLU4eOLaAYXgYW6bMOg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/knots-cafe-and-living-singapore?reviewid=PxkpbOmE-Jq3ipZITrudgA&select=Gk3mLU4eOLaAYXgYW6bMOg', 'altText': 'Photo of Knots Cafe & Living - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NN4uw564slzmaGUHEOBHUw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/knots-cafe-and-living-singapore?reviewid=PxkpbOmE-Jq3ipZITrudgA&select=NN4uw564slzmaGUHEOBHUw', 'altText': 'Photo of Knots Cafe & Living - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Kept seeing this in my Facebook feed so decided to try it this morning. Lovely place with eclectic furnishing. Food was ok. It was a bit hot though. Will come back.

Other than the chocolate Delice being a little dry got to say pastries are ok.   would not go all out to come by.   Coffee ok better than starbucks for sure.   Staff friendly and cafe with not too many seating.

Man the place is pack at 10:30am on a Friday??!!   Seems like nobody works here?   The noise level can be a little high but fortunately i got a slight ear infection so got bit of muffle ear.   Otherwise a nice utilitarian cafe.   Food again was wonderful even though place waa busy service was still good.

text: Fortunately, there are quite a few places in Singapore to grab a decent cup of coffee, and while I didn't actually end up having a coffee here, it is still one of those places where coffee is basically available at any time of the day. Actually, I just stopped here for a cup of tea, and it wasn't all that bad either, and neither was the price. In fact before I knew it, the tea was in front of me and I was merrily enjoying it. Oh, and it's also open twenty-four hours, which basically means you can also come here first thing in the morning and expect it to be open.

Ambience - check.   Nice zenly setup.   only issue is people walking thru from time to time.   good for biz? Service - Check. Friendly and attentive.   Food quality, taste and presentation - check check and check.   if there ia anything the salmon don is a little salty otherwise perfecto!   oh yes coffee? they nailed it!!   tried the softserve - wonderful.

Eggs Benedict', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Eggs Benedict'}]
text:
First time here. The food came quickly but the service staff needs a lot more training. They don't look happy as well. 

The waffles were good. I had the bacon cheddar waffles. Very fluffy and tasty. The Belgian waffles were good too. Eggs Ben ok, nothing to shout about. 

Nice place to have brunch as long as you're having waffles. Will come for lunch or dinner one day to try the rest of the menu.

text: CSHH coffee shop is quaint and boutique.  Coffee is awesome and the cakes have good selections.  They even have Nintendo games from year 2000s era!!!!   We will be back.  Highly recommended for a first date meet.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Xh2J685V0soFDtS1DJSnBQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-affogato-bar-singapore?reviewid=8V57r_G-2wy-fRqJ0xvAHA&select=Xh2J685V0soFDtS1DJSnBQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Affogato Bar - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3tkO5WZ2AsP5znhzA1jcJw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-affogato-bar-singapore?reviewid=8V57r_G-2wy-fRqJ0xvAHA&select=3tkO5WZ2AsP5znhzA1jcJw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Affogato Bar - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
Had high expectation for a delicious affogato since I was heading to THE affogato bar. But seriously, my least favorite affogato I've ever had. 

La opera is not my thing. The espresso was so bitter, the overly sweet chocolate ganache, almond sponge is all too much. The best part? Dark espresso ice cream but more like just normal coffee ice cream. And you can get away with $4.50 for one scoop. My buddy Lippy and I paid $15.90 for a bunch of Bla. ya.... should have just gotten a Milo Dino McFlurry.  yup, nice ambience, nice service but the affogato not so nice. 

#latergram #affogato #drklingeats

Brunch place in Bukit Timah. Had the signature mushroom on toast here and it did not disappoint. I got a huge slice of sourdough bread with an overflow of mushroom in white wine cream sauce topped with parmesan cheese. The dish was creamy, rich and delicious. The mushroom texture really goes well with the texture and creaminess of the sauce. While it could easily be too rich / heavy to be enjoyable beyond a few bites, this wasn't the case. I managed to finish the whole dish despite not being a fan of super creamy stuff. The only letdown is probably the bread which was a bit chewy to begin with and gets worse over time as it becomes too soggy from the creaminess of the mushroom. 

My friend had their other famous dish - the pancake - which was fluffy and as sinfully good. Would recommend checking it out.

Durian kaya toast... *Love*', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Durian kaya toast... *Love*'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fNOOADhK7e8NGinyVfMifw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ya-kun-kaya-toast-singapore-9?reviewid=7cN5Z5hby45f8zehaolLow&select=fNOOADhK7e8NGinyVfMifw', 'altText': 'Photo of Ya Kun Kaya Toast - Singapore, Singapore. Chasu toast.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chasu toast.'}]
text:
It's hard to miss Ya Kun Kaya, they are everywhere in Singapore! 

This particular joint is located near Far East Square, a much bigger venue than the other Ya Kun Kaya outlets. Plus point that they are open at 7: 30 am, to have your early breakfast in solitude. Their menu is simple - it's all about toast+ coffee/tea + soft boiled eggs, but those three things have served me well!

I got the savory chasu toast and the durian kaya toast. The chasu toast was quite flavorful, but the DURIAN kaya toast won a sweet spot in my heart!!  Perfectly toasted crisp bread sandwiching the rich and creamy durian paste added with kaya and butter - delicious and they smell so good *sniff sniff* :P 

Service was not exactly friendly, but at least they are speedy and efficient. Overall, Ya Kun Kaya Toast is an awesome spot to get your quick breakfast fix. I'll most definitely be back!

Famous bakery chain in Singapore known for its croissant. The croissant is the heavy dense kind (as opposed to the soft airy flaky one). The croissant is rich and guiltily good. The other signature item I would recommend is the Krouig Amman. Though a tad bit sweet, the crispiness of the pastry goes very well with the sugary filling which seeps through each layer of the pastry. Other dessert items are so-so.

One comment is the quality is a bit inconsistent across branches - the best one is at the original Tiong Bahru branch. Tried it at another outpost, but they slightly overbake/ burnt the croissant.

Brunch / lunch place with several outlets in Singapore. Tried their salmon and pancake in a skillet. The salmon is standard - decent quality salmon steak / nothing particularly special though. The pancake in skillet is good as expected - hot cake in hot pan come on. Taste was alright, have had better skillet pancakes elsewhere though

Restaurant feels a bit cramped

text: The food was beautifully presented but flavor and textures very average. I had the chicken pie with gravy. Filling was average in taste and the gravy watery. The mash was the best thing on the plate. The eggplant is served cold and pretty tasteless. Apparently the bangers and mash are ok. The scones have to be the most perfectly round scones I've ever seen. Texture wise very dense and heavy. I won't be in a hurry to come back.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=znN7_EVF1KjL7qxDodYyRQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Anusiya V.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Anusiya V.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=znN7_EVF1KjL7qxDodYyRQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 20, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I think if you are lost or duno where to go even if you are not hungry you can find a suitable haunt in this place. Any type of food is found here. delicious array of dishes. thanks.
Coffee is good, food is not bad. Good for a quick brunch. I don't think I'll come for a 2nd time.

I haven't visited in a long time as the service was bad. Sad to say service has not only not improved but has deteriorated. My breakfast came first. By the time is finished my husband's breakfast still has not come. We cancelled and left. It's a shame as the food is actually quite good.

Soy latte ($6 for regular) - 3.5 stars
Decent but wish it had a... stronger soy taste. They use Pacific not Bonsoy.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4NtjNvPExEowl8v2spCR7A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/twg-tea-on-the-bay-singapore?reviewid=yJuzpBe7lnKOTnKxsTcBdA&select=4NtjNvPExEowl8v2spCR7A', 'altText': 'Photo of TWG Tea on the Bay - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OgUldG7tM6iVwiie8-rG3g/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/twg-tea-on-the-bay-singapore?reviewid=yJuzpBe7lnKOTnKxsTcBdA&select=OgUldG7tM6iVwiie8-rG3g', 'altText': 'Photo of TWG Tea on the Bay - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/f77qETJ3wXIxCun9s3VmUA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/twg-tea-on-the-bay-singapore?reviewid=yJuzpBe7lnKOTnKxsTcBdA&select=f77qETJ3wXIxCun9s3VmUA', 'altText': 'Photo of TWG Tea on the Bay - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Apyvlpcm2ZSo9rkE5B6eCg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/twg-tea-on-the-bay-singapore?reviewid=yJuzpBe7lnKOTnKxsTcBdA&select=Apyvlpcm2ZSo9rkE5B6eCg', 'altText': 'Photo of TWG Tea on the Bay - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: You can't take photos in the store but you can whatever you want if you're having tea!  Service was outstanding and the truffle sandwiches were so good.  The Parisian tea set with two teas and snacks for two was $70.  So worth it.  And you can drink from the $200+ teapots and admire all the TWG branded swag like the linens, all porcelain, etc.  They have so many teas - it's ridiculous.  I'd recommend coming here at least once!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TV2o92oSMb6lQW-8BnhdWg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/maxwell-food-centre-singapore-3?reviewid=9fzJWFB7cK6AqisNWplaSw&select=TV2o92oSMb6lQW-8BnhdWg', 'altText': 'Photo of Maxwell Food Centre - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: So cheap and so good!  The Shanghai was dumplings, tian tian chicken rice and the banana fritter were so good!  The oyster pancake with different seafood was also very good. I'd recommend this place on the weekends when it's less busy although some of the stalls are not open.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/04kt_sqsoEMk2jyH3rI4mQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-53?reviewid=eOSGmD5qVOidkQm_GoOrOw&select=04kt_sqsoEMk2jyH3rI4mQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: The Mee Rebus was so good here - the noodles soaked up the curry. The toast was okay but the hot food was the standout.  I'd come back for the hot food.  This is a popular place but the pastry cabinet had ants in them and most people just had a coffee and toast.  They have plenty of seating so I think that's why it's also popular.  Fast and efficient!  Good place to grab a quick bite.
Good food good service good ambience.  The salad we had was a wee bit too sweet for our liking otherwise all good.  Heading back again next Tuesday.

Lassi Lychee Ginger Up Close @ And All Things Delicious Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Lassi Lychee Ginger Up Close @ And All Things Delicious Singapore'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/wC_CWcFJwUXj-UvXRRgRfQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/and-all-things-delicious-singapore-3?reviewid=ZYOYrsF5fcUhfAqKoit4nw&select=wC_CWcFJwUXj-UvXRRgRfQ', 'altText': 'Photo of And All Things Delicious - Singapore, Singapore. September 8th 2018 visit.'}]
text:
Another Muslim Owned Bakery + Cafe in town...

This establishment is ALWAYS jam packed to the brim at the time I want to go.  Recent visit was on Saturday September 8th 2018.  Time was before the Lunch hour at about 11:30hrs ish.  Furthermore, that recent visit was also on a weekend.

While waiting for HT, I decide to have some time alone to catch up on my emails what nots.  Decide to have a beverage here, among other things, a place which is air-conditioned to chill and take a breather.  THANK GOD for And All Things Delicious to the rescue!

Managed to get an empty seat inside the Café.  Made my order - 1 order of Lassi Lychee Ginger ($7.20) and one of the staffs send my order to the table where I was seated.  My Beverage order was indeed refreshing.  

All in all, And All Things Delicious owners or staffs can you please open another outlet...  *DOUBLE HINT* or at least open till LATE hours...  Thank You...

I may return to order the Mains aka Main Entrée that they also offer in the Café, maybe for Breakfast or Lunch coz from all the social media attention that they or other peeps posted, those Main Entrée looks so good aka to "drool" at...

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Y4pO9yZociD96rtJ5vRyDw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TpQzLZjm0bFPR48s_2Mm-A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TpQzLZjm0bFPR48s_2Mm-A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TpQzLZjm0bFPR48s_2Mm-A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TpQzLZjm0bFPR48s_2Mm-A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TpQzLZjm0bFPR48s_2Mm-A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TpQzLZjm0bFPR48s_2Mm-A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Lam N.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Lam N.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Y4pO9yZociD96rtJ5vRyDw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 2033, 'reviewCount': 557, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This place often stays quiet at meal times when Coffee Academics downstairs is full. Portions are large, but the food is really nothing to write home about.

Coffee chain in Singapore with several outlets in the city. The coffee here is pretty good but the desserts/cake can be improved. We shared several dishes and they are all average. The only good one is the cheesecake which has a good texture though also falls below expectation. Overall a good place for coffee / meet-ups but don't expect great pastries/dessert.

Been here a few times for desserts. I particular like their dark chocolate cake which was very decadent and has a rich chocolatey flavor. The slice is huge though and comes with an ice-cream so would recommend sharing.  Their cheesecake is also quite good. A bit pricey but ambience is nice / a good place to meet up with friends.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iU6pJloSDC2NF6-CktFLGQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/wakey-wakey-singapore?reviewid=eGDaegi7f1Bom1Ejs07SCA&select=iU6pJloSDC2NF6-CktFLGQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Wakey Wakey - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text:
Rating based on coffee dessert. Cute cafe next to my favorite pizza place. 
Espresso is phenomenal. The chocolate cake was super moist. Amazing. Perfect experience. 
No WiFi but the building has a public WiFi measuring at 9.70 mbps.

Nice play for brunch. We had the skillet eggs (their take on the Shakshouka) and Eggs Benedict. Slightly pricey even by Singapore standards but the food was tasty. Finished off with a pear crumble with ice cream which was delicious!!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VRDlGCZxqnhJ-S7WPhDsRQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=-AKooqqm4XRWq1we2-kRkA&select=VRDlGCZxqnhJ-S7WPhDsRQ', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iIy3a0iTIVsnWaXF0XG-yA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=-AKooqqm4XRWq1we2-kRkA&select=iIy3a0iTIVsnWaXF0XG-yA', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This cafe is very cool! Food is better than I expected, My Awesome Salad is very impressive, delicious indeed! Beef burger is also good, large portion, full of cheese. Juice is better than coffee. Decor and the service are also nice! Will definitely come back again!

Healthy café with several chains across Singapore. The food is pretty good across the board - some favorites are the grain bowls and soup with bread. Pastas are ok as well though a bit too saucy. 

If you want to reward yourself and be less healthy, would recommend the carrot cake which is amazing here.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dny4NA6chSiIG9sjDSbxUA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/sm%C3%B8r-singapore?reviewid=ERgShZm0ntFbTzyCSiuCCg&select=dny4NA6chSiIG9sjDSbxUA', 'altText': 'Photo of Smør - Singapore, Singapore. Coconut milk latte.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Coconut milk latte.'}]
text:
Nice place for coffee or a nordic breakfast near maple tree business city..was already full with breakfast so just tried the coconut milk latte..was very good..next time hope to try the food. 

WiFi is pretty good as well.

Healthy food place featuring salad bowls, grain bowls and less healthy dessert. The food is decent though a bit too saucy to be healthy. Desserts are a bit too sweet for me. But overall, a pretty nice space / good for catching up with friends.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8yRrdeoC0lEZUWVLlEYnuQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=20KCyHddaJpQEkhZXdu12A&select=8yRrdeoC0lEZUWVLlEYnuQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Chain serving kaya toast and traditional coffee / tea (Kopi / Teh) in Singapore. Both are pretty good but personally I prefer Yakun (another famous chain serving similar items). They also serve laksa, other bakery (cake, brownies, etc.) and other drinks (would recommend the barley drink). The venue in MBS is very convenient for a shopping break

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9akDo8Aez0bSGN2GveKDcQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hvala-chijmes-singapore?reviewid=DWgce4d0BCUrB6dU05JOLw&select=9akDo8Aez0bSGN2GveKDcQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Hvala CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Piccolo matcha latte ($5)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Piccolo matcha latte ($5)'}]
text:
Piccolo matcha latte ($5) - 4 stars
Got it without the syrup. Delicious!

They only serve whole milk - no soy here.

Italian restaurant in Fusionopolis popular for its set lunch (salad/soup, main (pasta, fish, etc.) and dessert. The food tastes ok / average - though generally the pasta is better than the fish / meat dishes. Pretty good value for money considering the portion

First impression waitress was a little irresponsive don't smile so nor exactly welcoming.   So that is a slight minus. Ordered salmon Yusheng, beef bowl and the claypot.  Now the Salmon Yusheng was not impressive as it is nothing usual though it did come in a nice bowl.   The beef bowl got to say the beef was done just right.   just a little too small.   claypot again the meat was done very well. but overall the price points are way off.   Would i be back? hmmmm.....

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MlxcyEDjZIqpmEmhIKyT3A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brunches-cafe-singapore-3?reviewid=cU_2lNzspLu0NQd5p_LT0A&select=MlxcyEDjZIqpmEmhIKyT3A', 'altText': 'Photo of Brunches Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Like this place! We came for Sunday brunch, not crowded. Food is delicious! Cajun chicken with rice ball is yummy, Spanish omelette is not bad, veggie pasta is in big portion, my son loves it so much. Good service as well! Will comeback again to try other dishes.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0c9rj8oSJa2Ha5PLm7dfJg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/central-perk-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KVEwj5NKLnoOLh-GfXl4tA&select=0c9rj8oSJa2Ha5PLm7dfJg', 'altText': 'Photo of Central Perk Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8Lhbmg3oAvKNTyXKK9n7hQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/central-perk-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KVEwj5NKLnoOLh-GfXl4tA&select=8Lhbmg3oAvKNTyXKK9n7hQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Central Perk Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/nrIc4r1yFwJZw6haf3YEyg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/central-perk-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KVEwj5NKLnoOLh-GfXl4tA&select=nrIc4r1yFwJZw6haf3YEyg', 'altText': 'Photo of Central Perk Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fYCZGxAskvr5j4pKIE_8yw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/central-perk-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KVEwj5NKLnoOLh-GfXl4tA&select=fYCZGxAskvr5j4pKIE_8yw', 'altText': 'Photo of Central Perk Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text:
F. R. I. E. N. D. S. Yeah!!! Who does t want to come and have coffee in Central Perk?! The inside is incredible! The real thing! Surrounded by Friends memorabilia, the show playing in a constant loop, the couch! It was a fun environment! The menu is very appealing and the coffee is fantastic! 
But the food tried too hard. My macaroni and cheese featured truffle oil. Yum! Except that it was like the whole bottle. The odor was so pungent I had to put my leftovers (almost 1/2 of it) on the other side of the table. 
The fries were almost amazing! Piping hot! But overly oiled (I'm seeing a pattern here) and no real flavor. Shawn and Ry shared the meatball sub. Made with barbecue sauce instead or marinara (not sure Joey would approve if that) the resounding feedback was: not that great. 
Very high prices in my opinion. Huge potential. Not quite there. 
We will probably go back, but as a tourist destination, not to actually eat.

text:
Tiong Bahru Food Market...

Friday November 16th 2018.  Time about 09:45hrs ish.

Definitely rich with Singapore History since 1951...  Way back that time, it is known as Seng Poh Road Market...  Found out about this Market since I follow religiously thru CNN or Travel Channel which featured the Late Anthony Bourdain.

Fast forward in 2018, I went here in order to run some errands.  This area is more concentrated with the Chinese population, and majority of the stalls or vendors are run by the Chinese.

Managed to get a Sugar Cane Beverage with Ice ($1.70) from Wang Wang Sugar Cane stall #02-27.  Decent and Doable Sugar Cane Beverage.  At least I get to have a beverage and a place for me to seat for awhile while trying to enjoy my snacks which I have purchased prior.

Thankfully while I was there, this Market was indeed kept cleaned.  It takes me about 10 to 15 minutes leisurely walk from the Tiong Bahru MRT Station.  If you commute by the Public Transport i.e. the Bus, it will take about 3 to 5 minutes.

I know for a fact, there is ONLY 1 Malay stall or Food Vendor at Tiong Bahru Food Market.  I do not mind returning and perhaps try what this Malay Stall has to offer.

In the middle aka "Courtyard", at Level 1, there is a mini playground for the kids.

At Level 1, the outer perimeter of this Market, some vendor sell clothes or accessories, while the inner side aka inside consists of the normal market you can find across town, for fruits, flowers, vegetables, meats, poultry what nots.

You can find parking on the 3rd Level.  As usual, in the mornings when I was here, this Market is indeed busy with other patrons alike, either for grocery shopping or having their Breakfast, thru Lunch.

Another Market for me to explore despite the lack of Halal vendors in this part of neighborhood.  I know my bestie likes to have her coffee just across the road.

All in all, a doable Market.  I will return and perhaps my review might differ.  Furthermore, I am indeed impressed with the recent discovery of this Market with all the Social Media, its getting known for.

text: Nice place to eat breakfast. It's kind of like a market place to eat all kinds of different kinds of breakfast. It's freshly cooked and authentic. It's real popular out here to try.

This is another place to come to eat where they have multiple kinds of food stands, but this one is located primarily in china town. I thought this hawker stand wasn't as good as the other one I went the day before which was called Tiong Bahru hawker.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bTGbGZi9GB_Iit5ioL7aaQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/asanoya-boulangerie-singapore?reviewid=wQFmrn2_u3LESaOURlOc8w&select=bTGbGZi9GB_Iit5ioL7aaQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Asanoya Boulangerie - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5FFhDYRLt9Zkdm0u0LoAug/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/asanoya-boulangerie-singapore?reviewid=wQFmrn2_u3LESaOURlOc8w&select=5FFhDYRLt9Zkdm0u0LoAug', 'altText': 'Photo of Asanoya Boulangerie - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Very fresh Japanese fresh bakery. Everything looked good to eat. I would recommend if your looking to get your bakery on to come here.
I not what it is but the lady up front is super rude. It's like a bakery slash coffee shop. I don't even know why I ordered what I did because of her attitude.

Green tea almond croissant ($4.50) - 4 stars
Much better than I last remember/reviewed, and probably one of the best croissants I've had in Singapore. Would love for it to be a bit less sweet though.

3.5 stars. Food truck coffee - moves around the city so need to check when they are gonna be in a certain location

Coffee here is decent though their latte is a bit too milky / the espresso is not strong enough.

Came in for the Sunday roast. What did I end up getting served was a VERY dry Sunday roast. Veggies were cooked all right, not mushy. However, the beef was very dry and couldn't even be reconstituted with gravy. Friendly but slow service as well. Definitely would not come back here.

Salmon with scrambled eggs and baked eggs wrapped in bacon", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Salmon with scrambled eggs and baked eggs wrapped in bacon'}]
text:
One of the best brunches I've had in a long time. Reminded me of the hipster brunch places in PDX, which is always a good first sign. They have delicious coffee.. a second good sign. Great vibe too, and its a hole in the wall place below a nondescript HBD complex. But easy enough to get too via MRT/Bus.
I got the smoked salmon with scrambled eggs and a baked tomato. The salmon was fresh, eggs were done perfectly. Wife got the baked eggs which were delicious, cupcake sized baked eggs wrapped in bacon on brioche..just mouth watering!! Had the affogato to wrap up brunch, and the espresso was just delicious, warm earthy tones, that paired well with the salted caramel ice cream. Must try place in SGP!

text: Unresponsive staff, slow service, l had to ask for sugar, it did not come with the coffee. Had to ask for salt for the eggs as well. The coffee cups are tiny and only half full. Not recommended!

text: Large size coffee, very comfy seating, and good ambiance. The food is quite good. The service has room for improvement. I recommend this place.

Ordered a chai tea and banana bread toast.  Toast was good, and tea made a few cups but I went there to work and realized after I got there that WiFi is only limited to 10 customers. That ruined my whole visit. Gosh--get with the modern day ages of having free WiFi...for all customers.

Excellent place to bring out of town guests or meet friends for a beer. It's cash only and they do have ATM's but the lines are typically long. Wide variety of food options and most of the food moves quickly, no heat lamp leftovers.

text: Nice ambiance and seating, but no cold water is served. Only mineral or sparkling water.

Matcha cream bun ($2) - 3.5 stars
Filled with a matcha cream and some red beans. Not too sweet and it's pretty soft and fluffy. The matcha flavour was evident but, for better or for worse, it barely had the bittersweet flavour characteristic of matcha. I'm not blown away but I'd get it in a pinch.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/14EhQuY-VFQnbCdr9mF4hw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/sunday-folks-singapore?reviewid=wJU_ribUAGvHhM2UoqmHkQ&select=14EhQuY-VFQnbCdr9mF4hw', 'altText': 'Photo of Sunday Folks - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Their soft serve ice cream is delicious! My friends and I came on a Sunday night and they were out of cones, so we opted for the soft serve in a cup and it was great. I tried the chocolate flavor, while my friend had the white rabbit (milk) which tastes just like the white rabbit candy. Will return again!

Love the creativity and abundance of gelato flavours here, but unfortunately the waffles lose out to Merely and Creamier. Still, good location (Bugis) and the 3-5pm promotion means I will still visit frequently.

French Waffle: 3.5 stars
Very eggy and warm out of the iron, but slightly overcooked, nothing extraordinary. Nice thing is they serve the waffles with crumbled Oreos, berry coulis and syrup on a pretty plate.

Brownie Waffle: 4 stars
Crispier and more flavourful than their French waffle. If you like chocolate or brownies (I'm neutral on both) you will LOVE these.

---- ICE CREAM ----

White Chocolate Nori:  5 stars
Lots of that umami seaweedy taste. Very generous with the chocolate chunks. So frickin tasty.

Yuzu: 5 stars

Lychee: 4.5 stars
Has lychee chunks in it!

Ale and Crack Candy: 4.5 stars
Sugar overload. Candied pecans, yumminess.

Triple-S:  4 stars
Shoyu, Sesame seeds, Salted chocolate. Super flavourful and slightly too salty, but I love the uniqueness.

Chocolate Stout: 3.5 stars
If you like the title, you'll probably like this flavour.

Salted Egg Yolk: 3.5 stars
Unfortunately my least favourite of all the flavours I tried. Tastes like 奶黄, but the texture lumpy gritty. And there are already so many salted egg yolk desserts so I don't particularly want to taste it again in my ice-cream.

Cornflake: 3 stars
Disappointing compared to Humphrey Slocombe's Secret Breakfast and Momofuku's Cereal Milk.

They also had some pretty standard flavours like Rum & Raisin, Goma, and more snazzy ones like Banana Honey Roasted Nuts, Smokey Road, Salted Caramel Cheesecake, Mala Chocolate but I couldn't try them all!

text:
Just what I needed today. Close, open, coffee, WiFi and pastries. Excited for them as today is opening day! I'm looking forward to trying and reviewing their upcoming menu for food, but I can attest to the coffee: smooth, rich and authentic. 
I look forward to future visits! Thanks Trevor for the wonderful neighborhood addition!

Simply lovely...short all the kids running around!  All kidding aside and also note that from bridal shower brunches, to an outing with your kids and family to a meet up with a another couple (as we did), Open Farm Community is simply charming.  We were there at 1:30PM on a Sunday and there were a lot of kids.  If kids are not your thing, then Sunday brunch here might not be your thing.

Outdoor and indoor seating, a reservation seems like kind of a must for a Sunday brunch and a beautiful menu full of locally grown ingredients where possible and a creative cocktail menu, we had no kids in our group and absolutely enjoyed our time and our meal.  

A charming setting, where the outdoors and indoors merge together in a this botanically lush setting.  Staff was friendly, welcoming and attentive.
